reviews.text: Loved it! Great service, and amazing food. The only bad thing was my family and I had to wait an hour and a half for be seated. We ended up waiting an extra 20 minutes because they had the wrong number, which we didn&#39;t know how that happened. Overall, it was really good though.

Staff were friendly &amp; courteous.  My daughter liked her buffalo wings. My son liked his pizza and spring rolls. My Brussels sprouts were OK, but pretty darn greasy/oily. My shrimp and chicken jambalaya was not good at all. It was prepared with both green pasta and the correct pasta. Not esthetically pleasing in the least!!! The pasta was dry &amp; flavorless. I detected NO tomato sauce or base. The food that I normally order is usually ok. I guess I made a bad pick this visit or the cook was overwhelmed:/

We ordered on line for curbside pickup at 5:53 pm. Their website is great until you pay; we had a gift card and what a mess during the check out process. We included a 15 percent tip for absolutely nothing; please read on. Going forward I will never prepay; wait until after I get my food, make sure everything is correct, and if a tip is DESERVED/EARNED I will include one!<br><br>Our curbside order was supposed to be ready at 6:18 pm. We followed procedure and called when we got there and nothing! Went inside and did not receive our food until 07:05 pm. For a restaurant that has seating for dozens of families cannot handle takeout orders. <br><br>By the time we got our food it was two and half hours later from time we ordered, and look what we got for our money.<br><br>The food was cold and so<br><br>The mushroom burger was ordered medium and was way undercooked, raw!<br><br>One the two chicken sandwiches was not prepared as ordered.<br><br>The chicken soup was placed in a sandwich container and spilled. You are telling me for $8.50 bowel of would you don&#39;t have the proper container l<br><br>Unacceptable and disappointing on ever point and every level. Their prices are expensive for what you get. <br><br>I will be calling the manager next day as I was too angry to call after we got our meal. I expect my money back.<br><br>This will be our last meal with Cheesecake Factory!

I have come to this location often and have never had an issue, but I was upset when I came to have dinner at 6:30 and was told that the indoor dining section was closed. I understand covid times, but I was most upset at the deliverance on how I was told about this. I walked in and the hostess and other employees sitting around the area looked at me without saying a word, obviously I was confused. Then one gentleman said &#34;What do you need&#34; then proceeded to say that the indoor dining was closed. I noticed when leaving, there was an older gentleman greeting and informing other guests about the situation, those employees should take after him.

Terrible! Very disorganized. Placed my order online and said it would be ready in 40 mins.  Even after I arrived to pick up my order i still waited another hour! That&#39;s is 100 mins for chicken fingers, pasta and a Caesar salad that were paid for online.  I understand they were busy but this is unacceptable! And they have every one waiting in the crowded vestibule so they can ask you you name and if you ordered online or by phone- VERY UNSAFE!!!!<br>This was the worst experience I&#39;ve had.  Cheesecake Factory is right down there with Applebee&#39;s <br>I won&#39;t be back!

I love the Cheesecake Factory because it is what it is.  A massive chain restaurant that has a menu as thick as a textbook and it&#39;s as varied as a library.    You want Italian? Got it.  You want Asian inspired? DONE.  You want southern home cooking.  Yup, that too.   I&#39;ve never had a not delicious meal from TCF, and I&#39;ve tried so many things.  This location seems pretty standard as far as matching the other locations I&#39;ve been too and I&#39;ve been very pleased with everything I&#39;ve gotten.  I even really enjoy getting drinks from here.  Their cocktails are usually pretty tasty and last night I had two of their new Strawberry Blossoms, delicious and worth it.    Funny enough, I typically don&#39;t get cheesecake here but I appreciate that they backup their name with 20+ flavors.   I&#39;m more here for the fried mac and cheeseballs and the drinks.  They also serve a pretty delicious veggie burger, one of my favorites.     This place is as family friendly as you can get when you want to feel like you are going out for a night on the town but really you&#39;re rolling down 1 stop light on 70.

I came in here to celebrate my father-in-law&#39;s birthday with my sister-in-law who lives a block away. They don&#39;t take reservation, but it was easy to get a table for 4 at 6 pm. It is just very difficult to find a parking spot in this popular shopping plaza. <br>My mother-in-law ordered Fish Taco per my sister-in-law&#39;s recommendation. BAD choice!!<br>W we waited more than 15 min before they served our dinner selections, although the freshly baked bread was delicious. The grilled fish on the Fish Taco was pretty cold. We asked the waitress to fix the problem and dish went back to the kitchen and the same plate came back with no difference. The manager came address this issue after our second complaint.  Another  long waiting, she brought back the new dish that claimed that to be cooked in prefect temperature. Well, it was not much better than the first one. My moth-in-law already lost her appetite <br>They did not charge us the Fish Taco Gabe is a slice of cheesecake to take home. However, I would definitely not recommend you fellow patrons order Fish Taco at all.

We ordered the Baja chicken tacos and the steak tacos At first I was a little disappointed with the size <br>BUT the entire meal was freaking DELICIOUS <br>I have never experience full joy from a meal before when I&#39;ve ate out <br>I regret nothing on this plate everything was amazing <br>I come from San Diego and live in Maryland I was visiting<br>It&#39;s been a long time since I&#39;ve been able to eat a decent restaurant &amp; order a decent meal this was 500 stars I&#39;m so happy!

A birthday dinner for two at a favorite restaurant of one. <br><br>Appetizer were great (Thai lettuce wraps, and sweet corn tamale cakes). <br><br>Unfortunately one of the birthday celebrants ordered the fish tacos and they were horrible, with that ammonia smell that bad fish has. They were sent back and the BDT shared my spicy cashew chicken (which was just ok).<br><br>The piece of Dulce De Leche Caramel cheesecake we shared was delicious<br><br>Usually we are feeling much better about the food when we leave TCF but were dissapointed in this dining experience

Let me start off by saying I&#39;m a huge cheese factory lover you can&#39;t beat the consistency you get at this place even with the massive menu selection.<br><br>Which is why , I do this with reluctance (insert tear face emoji ) .. cheesecake you let me down.<br>I love this place so much I decided to order a quick grab to go meal for my toddler and myself after work bc I had no intention on cooking. I order a WELL DONE burger for myself and the chicken sandwich slider kids meal for the kid. By time I get to cheesecake the hostess lets me know my order is just being finished (perfect timing) . <br><br>I pay for my food and hit the road . Now I have a good 20min drive before I get home depending on the traffic but by time we sat down and said our prayer and went to dig in, I was thoroughly impressed bc the food temperature was still warm enough to not have to reheat ( yay me )<br><br>Now the kid is digging in and I prepped my burger with all the fixings and slice it down the middle to get the perfect bite and what do I see ... a pink burger and I don&#39;t mean medium well pink ,which I could work with ,I mean damn near raw which  ..... DOGGONIT! the whole point was to not have to do work but now I gotta try to salvage this thing so I had to recook my darn burger . .. it was a sad day for me as I wound up having to preheat the oven , take all my toppings of the darn bun, remove the cheese from the burger , throw it on the cast iron pan and put it in the oven .<br><br>I will say the burger was so raw that even after slicing it in half and reheating it didn&#39;t dry out too much so when I remade it it was still nearly decent . <br><br>Also I ordered the red velvet cheesecake slice for desert and for the first time ever the cake portion of it was a dry idk how long that one had been sitting but ,I can say I&#39;ve had most of the cheesecakes they offer here and this has never happened before so maybe it was an off day . <br><br>So I say all this to say beware of the takeout burgers. Although there&#39;s really no way you can check for that .  attached pictures but they don&#39;t really capture how the cow was still mooing ! :-/

Door Dash has since refunded the amount of money. That is appreciated. But I&#39;ve heard multiple people say that the Cherry Hill Cheesecake Factory is not clean. Others have had similar experiences.

Ordered takeout today. The shrimp and angel hair pasta dish was good but they gave me a whole plate of pasta worth about 67 cents and 5 shrimp??? Really? Then had the nerve to charge full price. This is exactly why I rarely order take out from any restaurant during this pandemic. Every restaurant wants you to support them but they cut corners. You can order from Cheesecake Factory if you want to but expect to get ripped off.

Tried to go to Cheesecake Factory two times now in Cherry Hill.  We had 9 people on a Saturday at 3pm.  We were told they did not take reservations on weekends.  We figured 3 pm was early but not so.<br><br>Weeks later I tried again with 9 people .  This time at 2 pm. .   Again we were told it would be about 1  <br>1/2 hr wait.  Others were going ahead of us cause they had 4 or less.  They could learn to move tables together.  <br><br>We went to the Tuscan restaurant (Brio) just across the parking lot both times.  They were great.  Even giving us a private room.

We ordered take out for our Mother&#39;s Day dinner. I applaud all of the people cooking, fulfilling orders and running the orders out to their customers&#39; cars. The servers delivering orders were under verbal attacks and accosted with frantic and demanding customers. Please people,  be patient and understanding of folks who are working in front lines trying their best to service you under these chaotic, frantic, and dangerous times. Tip your server... exercise empathy....please. These people probably need these jobs to survive during this pandemic and failing economy.  We should all show compassion during these times. Thank you to the cooks and service people at The Cheesecake Factory. I applaud you! The food was good too!

I am torn weather to leave my review as 4 stars or drop at the three stars. when I checked in here and I saw that the restaurant was three stars I was confused because normally this place is pretty good. Our server was great we had no issues with her and the cheesecake is always top-notch. The dinners were okay guess you expect more for the price you&#39;re paying. The Thai chicken lettuce wraps where the highlight. They are great appetizer. I guess I can see why the ratings dropped a bit is the food while good is not great. Also the kitchen seems to bog down and slow down when they are very crowded. I left my reading at a 4, because the appetizers and cheesecake were great as well as the service. Third time will be the charm to see if it drops. people nowadays are looking for a lot more bang for the buck, and after having an appetizer two meals and two pieces of cheesecake, and it&#39;s $90...

Have eaten here a few times and Everytime has been excellent. Restaurant is clean and well maintained including the bathrooms. Service is snappy and the staff is knowledgeable about the menu. This place is not cheap by any means and lunch will run you around $70-$80 with an app or dessert. I ordered fettuccini Alfredo and it was excellent! My wife had the 4 cheese pasta and she said it was very good. Apps are extremely plentiful as well as the dishes, they come in 1/2 and full size. Of course we had to try some cheesecake so I got the Godiva chocolate and my wife got the banana cream and both were excellent, $10 each but excellent. If your looking for something with good high end food but not quite the high end atmosphere this is the place to go.
love love love this place!  very good food. <br>my favorite cheese cake is reese&#39;s peanut butter chocolate cake cheesecake!!

Had the carne asada steak medallions then the apple crisp.  All thumbs up for carne asada perfectly cooked in a chipotle sauce with onions and peppers.  Paired with white--yums!!<br>Dessert was warm apple crisp---not bad but not great--just ok.  I didn&#39;t like the oats on it.  Entree left me busting at the seams. Nice portion.  Great friendly wait staff.  My sister had a decadent chocolate dessert.

Came for dinner. Had thai chicken wraps. It was so good! I loved the sauces that went with it!! My favorite is the green one! It is definitely enough as an entree. I also had the red velvet cheesecake which was super yummy. It is my favorite! Service was good! Very nice. Had a good time.

Beside the Philly location, I love this location too!!! However, you have to time everything or else you&#39;ll end up with a wait time. The cheeseburger spring rolls are so delicious!! Be careful biting into them because they&#39;re so hot from frying that all the oil is still so sizzly on the inside. The sauce that comes with the spring rolls seems to me like a mix of ketchup, maybe mayo? I don&#39;t really know what it is, but I love it. I always get the Farfalle with chicken and roasted garlic. It is AMAZING and filled with so many flavors!!! You will not be disappointed if you want something bold. My boyfriend got the tomato basil pasta. He literally orders this all the time. It&#39;s his favorite. If you&#39;re craving chocolate, get the Linda&#39;s fudge cake. It is SO YUMMY AND RICH. It totally hits the chocolate craving. <br><br>It&#39;s quite loud inside and I&#39;m not a big fan of the tables for 2. I feel that I&#39;m sitting so close next to the person next to me. This is not a 5 star review because I thought cleanliness was a bit poor and we went around 1 pm this past Saturday. Menus were EXTREMELY greasy. I was quite grossed out with it. Table and seats had crumbs atop when we were seated.

The service was great and everyone was pleasant. I sat at a high tower and was greeted immediately. The The waitress was pleasant prompt with serving drinks water and suggestions I ordered the classic jambalaya which I&#39;ve always got gotten. I&#39;ve been going to cheesecake factory since the early 90s when they were not in Pennsylvania and New Jersey area. The first one I&#39;ve ever experience was in Las Vegas. The jambalaya was on point and was served hot.
The food is always GOOD here. My boyfriend and I usually go here in the daytime when they are less busy. So, we don&#39;t usually have to wait for a table which is great!
Best customer service walked in had reservations and was seated in seconds. Food was great and are server was also a10 he quick and New the menu

After getting shi$$y a$$ service, I now come home hoping to dive into the cheesecake I ordered only to find rotten bananas!!!! Are you kidding me?? Who serves shit like this to customers?? I&#39;m pissed!!! If I didn&#39;t live over 20 minutes away, I&#39;d take it right back. My kids have been looking forward to this cheesecake all evening after waiting 30 minutes for our food :(   Completely pissed and highly annoyed. I won&#39;t be going back. Not to this location.

Went in on 2/17/20 for happy hour. Was told they didn&#39;t do happy hour on a holiday, even though there was a giant sign in the lobby advertising it. The bartender was very rude and abrupt. I attempted to contact them on their website and no response. Terrible customer service, will not be going back and will tell everyone I know. AVOID, so many other nice places in Cherry Hill with better customer service.

I am a huge fan of the Cheesecake Factory. It&#39;s one of the few chains I will eat at. We were here this past Thursday for an early dinner. I like this location.<br><br>The server was extremely pleasant and helpful. We started with the crab cakes and the mozzarella wedges. The crab cakes were delicious and packed with crab meat, I actually bit into a shell. The mozzarella was just as good. Very fresh and not your typical fried junk.<br><br>For entrees we went with the chipotle chicken sandwich and the turkey burger. Often turkey burgers are dry, not this one. The burger was amazing! Moist and flavorful, I did seek a bit of spice. The chicken sandwich was also very good but it was very very large and heavy. The chicken was a bit on the greasy side but hey it&#39;s fried chicken. The buns on both were perfectly toasted. We opted for salad instead of fries. The citrus dressing is to die for!  We will be back! 4 stars..

This is the best Cheesecake Factory location ever! The service is fast and friendly. The food is always fantastic and I truly believe it&#39;s because it&#39;s very well managed.  I don&#39;t think people realize how difficult it is to run a business like this restaurant, with all the moving parts needed to serve people and prep work that needs to get done before customers actually come in. Kudos to the manager, for keeping everything great and consistently great! That&#39;s the tough part right there, consistently great!

The wait can be brutal so make sure you&#39;re not starving. On any given weekend I&#39;ve had to wait upwards of 40 minutes to an hour. The menu options are so vast that even after a dozen visits I&#39;ve only discovered the tip of the iceberg. An all time favorite of mine is the Thai Chicken Lettuce wraps. It&#39;s listed under an appetizer but it&#39;s large enough for an entree. Every meal starts with delicious freshly baked bread and creamy butter; the hallmark of any higher end restaurant. I&#39;ve tried and loved the chicken Marsala, the tossed green salad is superb and I&#39;ve savored a number of their awesome and decadent dessert. Trust me when I say their food is well worth the wait!!! <br><br>Ps the service is consistently good, manager is quick to get involved in any issues with your meal.
The food is very good but VERY pricey for what you get. The service tends to be slow, but friendly and efficient. But let&#39;s face it, you come here for the cheesecake... and it is fantastic.

Just sat down to a dinner which took about 2 hours, in which, it felt like our waiter forgot us for about an hour. Dinner itself was good, but then tried to order a slice of cheesecake to be eaten in the restaurant. After another 10-15 minute wait, we received our cheesecake Except the cheesecake came out FROZEN! The waiter, when informed it was frozen, showed his manager, who DID ABSOLUTELY NOTHING! He did not come over and even say &#34;sorry about that&#34;.  We were not looking for it to be taken off the bill or anything but yet for the manager to not say anything is very, very disappointing. <br>Extremely poor service from top to bottom tonight.

I don&#39;t want to leave this but there&#39;s nothing I can do about the mistakes that were made on my order and this upsets me ALOT. <br><br>I just ordered from this restaurant via DoorDash: I ordered the Nashville nuggets and factory burrito. Nuggets (WHICH ARE SPICY) came with no sauce and factory burrito (WHICH IS SPICY!) came with no avocado, sour cream OR lettuce to cool the spice! I have to admit that I&#39;m mad af. I don&#39;t want to be THAT customer but I am. Cheesecake Factory isn&#39;t cheap; I can at least get the condiments that come with the fuckin food! <br><br>And DoorDash is no help, as usual. Our money is a joke to these damn companies! Fuck y&#39;all.

2 stars because I still love Cheesecake Factory as a whole, but this location just misses the mark every time. The service is so horrendous. Like most parents with inpatient young children, I was sure to order my toddlers entree immediately upon being greeted so she could eat and not fuss. When she came back with our drinks, we placed our appetizer orders. Bread came shortly after... but then 25 minutes of NOTHING. This was 5:20pm on a Thursday. We were seated immediately upon arriving and it was no where near what a normal busy night at Cheesecake Factory looks like, so it was even more bizarre that our server ghosted us for 25 minutes before seeing our appetizers. No update, no checking on us, nothing. And definitely no sign of getting my daughters kids meal. Finally a food runner brings our appetizers out with the standard &#34;be careful the plates are hot&#34; warning... aka the food has been ready for quite some time now and has been sitting under the food warmers. My biggest restaurant pet peeve... probably only because I served for years and know that a hot plate doesn&#39;t mean freshly made food. I had to again ask about my daughters food which was then brought with the same &#34;hot plate&#34; warning. We finish our appetizers quickly and it&#39;s a good 10 minutes before anyone comes to clear the plates. Never got checked in on by our server either. At this point my husband is trying to talk me out of even getting dessert because at this rate we feel like we will be sitting here another hour before we see our entrees. Thankfully, entrees came out and food was great, as it always is at CF. Our server comes to check on our entrees and I quickly get in my Cheesecake order to try to expedite the already slow service. The Oreo cheesecake was amazing, as always, and thankfully put me in somewhat of a better mood than the awful service. The other CF locations I&#39;ve frequented in NJ (Lawrenceville and Edison) have always had fantastic service and has always seemed to hold their servers to a high standard. This is not the first poor service experience I&#39;ve had in Cherry Hill, but was the first experience bad enough to review.

My all time favorite place to go for dinner with the family!! Of course the Thai Lettuce Wrap and the Steak Diane is my fav as well!! Good food for a great price. Drinks are pricey but taste good. Love this location!

We had a party of 4 and we all tryed a different pasta dish . We all enjoyed our food . The atmosphere and the service was great.The prices were also good. It was a large portion meal and we took dessert home. The cheescake was exceptionaly delicious!! BANANA  . Pineapple and Hazelnut 3 separate flavors were what we had. Cannot wait to try key lime cheesecake next. Enjoyabe time.

Had dinner here tonight for my sister&#39;s birthday - from start to finish everything was delicious. Perfect timing on courses, refills when needed, and the burger I ordered was cooked perfectly to order. But the cherry on top of it all was our server, Calvin. He was patient, knowledgeable, and kind, and made the experience that much more delightful.

The cheesecake factory is arguably my favorite chain restaurant other than Yard House in Moorestown. Huge selection, good sized portions, and of course, incredible cheesecake. I don&#39;t come that often simply because I&#39;m not in Cherry Hill a lot...but also because this place is ALWAYS packed. No reservations on weekends so you&#39;re gonna wait no matter what. Even at noon on a Saturday there was a 15 minute wait and it was packed. The seating for tables of two isn&#39;t ideal...as the tables are really close to one another. On our last visit it was so loud inside it didn&#39;t really matter that the tables were close, you couldn&#39;t hear anyone next to you and vice versa. The restaurant was clean and our server Veronica was really sweet and attentive, and went out of her way to split up our bill. On to the food! We came because we had a gift card and we opted for apps, drinks, and shared some cheesecake. Everything was delicious. The pork belly sliders with fried pickles were amazing. My new favorite appetizer here for sure. The pork belly itself was crispy on the outside but not dry, and was packed with flavor. The dynamite shrimp  was a little greasy but the breading was light so it was still good. The cheesecake is always a home run here as the name of the place indicates, and the white chocolate macadamia nut cheesecake definitely didn&#39;t disappoint. Only 4 stars because it&#39;s always insanely crowded and the parking lot is a circus. But the food is consistently good and I&#39;m sure I&#39;ll be back.

Guess what! We put our order in and the they forgot my order. I got the chance to take in the ambience for a whole 45 mins before my food came. So, I had to become the bad guy which sucks uggggh. I hate having to be the bad guy but the other server did say she must have forgotten. So, here&#39;s one star. Perhaps if she said &#34;Hey, I&#39;m sorry&#34; I wouldn&#39;t be writing this. Buuuuut. What the hell.

It was a brisk September afternoon, I left work early that day to run some errands and found myself with some time to spare. Just peeking out the corner of my eye was the Cheesecake Factory. I figured let me stop in and grab a cheesecake slice for my beautiful wife to brighten her day a little. As I walked in I heard Jack Daniels calling my name so went straight to the bar, and ending up hanging out there for a while. Although I was having a drink alone, I was not sharing a drink called loneliness (Billy Joel reference). The atmosphere surely made me feel like I was somewhere else, and the staff all greeted me as they passed by as of I was just welcomed into their neighborhood. After finishing my drink, I parted ways and headed back to my car. As I was driving away and knowing it takes 25 minutes to make a u-turn in Jersey I completely forgot about the cheesecake....FML.

Late night craving after a nice dinner with my beautiful girlfriend. We decided that we want some dessert. &amp; we were close to cheesecake so we decided to give it a try. We order a slice of tiramisu to go. They asked us if we wanted whipped cream so we didn&#39;t mind that. We wait 10 minutes there until we got your desert. Keep in mind we were the only one in line. The bagged up and gave it u to us. The surprise we got when we got home. Just look at this photo and tell me what wrong. We paid $10 for half of the cake was missing at the very least &amp; it look like they tried to compensate with the amount of whipped. The first time I saw this much whipped cream on a slice of cake.

The atmosphere was nice but the silverware was dirty, dried green stuff on my bread plate, something weird in my side of mayo. Not sanitary enough for me. But the place is always bumping. Not sure why. I must have missed something. Cheesecake was great of course. Nashville nuggets were good.

This location made my 3 year old cheeseburger sliders. After she ate half of it, I realized it was uncooked. Not rare. Uncooked. The manager was nice and apologetic which I appreciate. They did remove one dessert and her meal off the bill. However, this is 100% unacceptable. She still ate uncooked meat.

I really went back and forth with myself over writing this review, but I feel obligated to forewarn other guests. My friend and I stopped here for a late dinner after work on Sunday, and it wasn&#39;t as busy as it usually is when I go. We had a wait of barely 5 minutes, and were sat in a little corner. <br><br>I totally understand that servers work for tips, and sometimes it&#39;s hard not to judge people based on appearance, but this is probably the first time that I&#39;ve felt that what I was wearing significantly effected the quality of my service. Mistake number one, was wearing jeans and a T-shirt. I felt like we were stashed in a corner to not take away from the overall vibe of little dates and dinner gatherings that were going on around us. <br><br>Our server brought us out two waters and greeted us, ran down dinner and drink specials and asked if we&#39;d like to put in an appetizer or get anything else to drink. In retrospect, this was where we made mistake number two. My friend decided to just go with water, no alcohol to bump up the tab, and told him she was gong to have an appetizer as her entree. We asked for a few more minutes, as I hadn&#39;t decided on a dinner yet. This was the turning point of our visit. <br><br>The soda that I ordered took about 20 minutes to come out, when he then asked if we&#39;d like bread while we wait. The bread took another 10-ish minutes, and the meal came almost immediately afterwards. No inquiry about a refill on any drinks, and we didn&#39;t personally have his attention after the food was dropped for about another 45 minutes. However, he was gushing over the table seated immediately next to us, who appeared to be on a date. They ordered alcohol, appetizers, meals and were dressed very nicely. He stopped two or three times to have full 3-5 minute conversations with them, while totally ignoring us. No three bite check in, no refills, nothing. He was consistently present and attentive to his other tables, just not us. <br><br>Maybe he thought we were a couple and didn&#39;t like that? Maybe the casual, young adult in jeans and a messy bun appearance causes unintentional judgement because we look like we don&#39;t tip well? Maybe our not ordering $100 worth of food made him feel as though we were a waste of time? In reality, we were saving room for the $50 in cheesecake that we wound up ordering at the take away counter, because two hours for a quick meal was too long to be there already, and if we didn&#39;t ask for the check when we did, who knows when we would have seen him again. We didn&#39;t drive 30 minutes to this establishment to be treated worse than a minimum wage fast food worker would have treated us. On top of everything else the bathroom was a disaster. Do better, Cheesecake Factory. This was such a disappointment. We won&#39;t be back.

The food was only average at best. One thing I cannot tolerate is a restaurant with a disgusting bathroom. This one seemed like the staff at Cheesecake Factory completely forgot there was a bathroom to check up on! It was a hot mess in there to say the least. If it weren&#39;t for the nice ladies lined up in a synchronized line passing the single roll of toilet paper to the next person in line after coming out of the one stall that wasn&#39;t clogged, I think there would have been a more serious problem. Cheesecake Factory: how do you expect us to use the bathroom?! Thank goodness it wasn&#39;t #2

Just an average dining experience.  My wife&#39;s meal was burnt and not sure how it made it out of the kitchen without someone flagging it.  The manager removed it from the bill. My chopped salad was good and was from the skinny menu. We finished off the meal with the Oreo cheesecake which was good and very rich. We will go again? Maybe in a few months.

Food was ok. Just shared chicken Madeira with my husband. Chicken was fairly good but the pasta it came with (replaced the potatoes) was quite cold and stuck together. The most offensive part of the meal was the waiter. He had just smoked a cigarette and every time he came to our table his following of a just smoked cigarette wasn&#39;t very pleasant. This should not be allowed while serving.

I thought it was better than the 3 stars listed. We arrived at 5:30 on a Friday night and it was totally full. A delightful night so we decided to eat out doors. We were the first to go outside to eat. We had a delightful waiter who recommended a &#39;lite&#39; dinner. I was very good.  Both of us had the capellini with shrimp and asparagus. Nice sauce and freshly made warm bread. I thought the pricing was high for a lite dinner but the service and food were good. I would not have eaten inside. The noise level was much too high.

I used to love this place! Whatever I ordered was good.  It has been two years since I visited there.  Some of the menu item were changed/added.  Mushroom soup was good first three sips.  After that I only tasted salt and sherry.  It was not eatable.  Prosciutto flatbread had prosciutto shortage.  There was barely prosciutto on a pizza dough.  Korean BBQ style cauliflower was pretty bad.  The sauce was too heavy and sweet.  It was not Korean style at all.  It was almost sad to see one of the good restaurant is serving food like that.  And on top of that, little kid screaming from near booth.  The dining experience was not good this time.

I literally come here every Sunday for brunch. I just wanted to post this picture of that cinnamon roll pancakes because they are so good. They come with this handmade syrup in is so good but you really don&#39;t need it because the pancake it so flavorful.

It was pretty good not bad at all. Service a little slow busy night! We had calamari and guacamole for appetizers. Our entries were the grilled salmon it was good. The Steak Diane it was ok not that great and the Chicken Maderia was really really good. Our bill was $113.00 I think it was pretty reasonable not bad at all for 3 people. I would go back to this place but it&#39;s not one of my favorite places but ok if your hungry and want to have a lot of options. There menu is huge and you can special requests certain things.

Do not order their skinny small plate Ahi Tuna Poke!! It&#39;s a tiny teaspoon of food and four ... that&#39;s accurate just 4 chips . 3 of them won&#39;t be needed with barely any food on the plate. So then for this privilege to enjoy a night out of cocktails and appy&#39;s , we paid $9.50. The drinks are excellent and the sliders very good but avoid small plates . How embarrassing for CF, since they&#39;re always a target for ridicule for serving huge plates.
The servers at this restaurant are very young and inexperienced. They seem lost as to how to attend to client needs. Most appear to be under the age of twenty. Perhaps this is the problem
Excellent service delicious food was there celebrating my children birthday they love it thank i you n keep up the good work

4 stars for the apps and service. 1 star for the &#34;Sheppard&#39;s pie&#34;. It&#39;s not even a pie. Sheppard is supposed to be the sheep not ground beef. It&#39;s just beef stew and mashed potatoes on top. It was greasy and the flavor was not good. I just ate the mash potato cause I love mash potatoes but the meat was not the correct meat. Why are they advertising shepherds pie if you&#39;re gonna get this trash. It ruined my meal and I left very disappointed. <br>Don&#39;t get this trash food. Cheesecake Factory has very delicious food and the service is excellent so I&#39;m not bashing the company on why it&#39;s bad, I&#39;m just ranting on this dish.
I ordered tuna tartar and Asian lettuce wraps ... took them 25 minutes to bring it out .... and just to be clear - that&#39;s an appetizer . But the food is delicious ! Totally worth the wait !

We had the worst service tonight. <br><br>After a long wait for the table, we put our order in. The waitress didn&#39;t bring us the bread basket for a long time and after that she pretty much forgot about things she told us she will bring (ex. hot sauce, utensils, &amp; a clean dish). She brought a wrong chicken dish...She brought us desserts without any forks (because she cleared the whole table) so we waited again. Time in waiting was so wasteful and unnecessary. <br>Service was terrible. Food was just ok. Won&#39;t be going back.

I finally had cheesecake at The Cheesecake Factory and I was very happy with it - I had the Godiva and it was both rich and light if that makes sense.<br><br>My lovely &#39;friend&#39; had the salted caramel and that was really delicious too!  <br><br>Their menu is so extensive that you could get overwhelmed but in the best way! <br><br>Id go back to try a few others for sure!

The staff was very accommodating. My little cousin wanted to change her order. They sang &#34;Happy Birthday&#34;, to my 80 year old Uncle. The waitresses were very pleasant. One con is that it was about a 45-minute wait for a table for a party of our size.

I am not ashamed to admit that before today I was a 40+ year old Cheesecake Factory virgin. I had nothing against the business, but no real desire to lose my chasteness. Now that I am no longer pure, I can honestly say that I can see the appeal this place has on people from all walks of life. <br><br>First of all, the decor in this location is quite interesting. We both remarked that it had something like a Disney and or resort-ish effect. For some reason you just feel good, and at ease too. Second, the sheer quantity of choices should be able to appease even the pickiest of the picky. I can&#39;t comment on the quality, we were here for dessert only. And last but not least, their namesake option does not disappoint.<br><br>My friend chose Godiva chocolate, and I opted for salted caramel. What I&#39;m leaving out is that it took us ten minutes to narrow our selection down since the choices are vast. We enjoyed both slices. The tastes were fresh and intense, with lovely plating. Almost as lovely as my desserting companion, but not quite.<br><br>To sum up, I would recommend CF to families with younguns, or those looking for casual fare with an ending that is sure to be happy. I think people from other cultures visiting the U.S. might also enjoy the experience of dining or at least desserting here. 3.75 sweet cheesy Yelps.

I absolutely can not believe how rude I was treated by the manager. Our food had to be taken back two times after coming out late!!! The manager asked me to share my food with other guest while we wait for food to be returned!!! How about I have never been treated so rude in all my life in a restaurant! I want to leave but I have people with me that&#39;s hungry because we waited so long!!!! AWFUL!!!! The Manager needs training.

Loud. Slow service. Friday night. Worst dining experience. Literally sounds like you are in a high school cafeteria. Have to yell to talk to the person across from you. Sat in the middle area, like so you can smell the cologne on the person next to you that you didn&#39;t come with. People next to us sat down after us and were greeted and served before us. Loud banging dishes, loud music, and screaming children the entire time.  Chicken tacos, white chicken chili and egg roll sampler were good but not worth the environment. The high $ menu items are better in a dozen more places nearby without the trash atmosphere.

Who writes a review about a chain restaurant? Me that who. Graduation season is upon us so the wait was a little long but hey how can you be mad. <br><br>I skipped the app and ordered the Crispy Chicken and Shrimp in a sweet and sour sauce. It had mushrooms,scallions, snow peas and cilantro. Other than too much breading on the chicken the dish was very  good. They offer a sautéed option for those that don&#39;t want fried. Recommend
delicious!!!!!! chicken and biscuits! i&#39;m going back just for this dish!

Great place to catch up with old friends and split lots of different types of food.  It is avrry busy restaurant so it may be best not to go during prime time.  But you have the ability to walk around Barnes and Nobles and the signal still reaches. <br><br>First off, the service was great.  They were kind and considerate.  The server recommended their favorites and they were all great suggestions.  They were capable of answering questions about their extensive menu.<br><br>Many of the pastas are great choices, but read the description to make sure you enjoy what it contains.  I would recommend the cauliflower apitizer, it will surprise you in both bold taste and melt in your mouth texture.  I would not recommend the cheeseburgers for those who do not like greesy burgers.  The cheesecake is fine, but can be overwhelmingly sweet.  Recommended to share a slice.<br><br>The pricing is a little high, but to be expected for the location and food portions.

Want a delicious alcoholic beverage poured riiight? The Cheesecake Factory never lets me down. LOVE the passion fruit mojito.... probably my absolute favorite drink.<br>The chicken samosas appetizer is sooooo good.<br>Also love the Jamaican blackened chicken and shrimp.... the rice, beans, plantains, pineapple along with the shrimp and chicken is sooooo good.<br>Miso glazed salmon is another favorite

So I have not been here in about 10 years. At that time I was not impressed.<br> We happen to get a gift card for Christmas to the cheesecake factory and decided to use it sooner than later. We arrived and were seated promptly in a very nice clean booth near a window. We were greeted with water and bread right when we sat down. <br> In my opinion the menu is too extensive. I had to turn the waitress away 3 times because there were too many choices.  This can end up being a blessing and a curse. I love that there&#39;s such a variety on the menu, but it makes a very difficult to decide what you want to order. I got the ahi tuna small plate, and the farmers appetizer salad.  My fiance got the pizza style chicken Alfredo. He absolutely loved his. The ahi tuna was delicious! And my appetizer salad was far from being an appetizer. It was massive. The dressing was one of the best salad dressings I&#39;ve ever had.<br>Our waitress was unbelievably attentive and nice. We got the original cheesecake to share. My goodness what a delicious cheesecake! We have not dined at the cheesecake factory together before.  But you can bet that we will be back!

My three colleagues and I stopped in for lunch.  It was my first time dining at a CCF.  We were seated right away.  The dining area was open and huge.  The menu was overwhelming- too many choices!  The appetizers we ordered were great.  In fact, the guacamole was the best that I have had.  The cheesesteak rolls were tasty too and the cocktails accompanied this course well.  My margarita was good but it was a little smaller than I expected.  I ordered the stuffed cheeseburger with no roll.  It was presented nicely but it was very average to me.  The others in my group seemed to enjoy their meals.  My colleagues were not interested in cheesecake so unfortunately I did not get to try any.  If I return, I will probably order an appetizer and dessert.  Overall, I found the  prices high.  The best part of the experience was our server Amanda.  She was on point!  Kudos to her for her knowledge, efficiency and friendliness.

This is one of my favorite restaurants ! The food here is so good, and there are countless amount of options from seafood to Italian ! Also there dessert menu is phenomenal, I&#39;m lucky I haven&#39;t tried everything on it ! My favorite is the Oreo dream extreme cheesecake, but they have many other options! Also this restaurant is very kid friendly. :)

Let me just say I come here a lot, I had came in last night at 10:25pm. I was seated by my server which is a light skin African American male with an Afro puff. We ordered drinks and he told my fiancé that since his ID isn&#39;t horizontal some places wouldn&#39;t serve him, incorrect, I&#39;m a bartender myself. He provided the worst customer service ever, we asked for crab meat dip appetizer and our appetizer still wasn&#39;t out yet. It was 11:07pm and we finally got our dinner with no appetizer. I had mentioned the appetizer to him and his response was &#34;i can either take it off the check or bag it up&#34; i asked him to bag it up, he comes back out and says &#34;unfortunately it was never turned in Sorry guys&#34;. Wtf? This is the worst service I&#39;ve ever had, literally. Disappointing, Cheesecake Factory needs to live up to its name and luxury, you can&#39;t have luxury and awful service.

food was good besides the fact that they put my pizza on a dirty ass dish !!!!  old ass celebration cake sprinkles under my pizza is a major no! <br><br>my fave thing to order is their &#34;pizza with the works &#34; and a side cesar salad ! juuuuuuust hold the sprinkles next time

PARKING: Free parking lot outside!!<br><br>Came here with 11 other friends(not including me) for a surprise birthday dinner after coming from skyzone... so yes expect this review to be more about if me and my friends were filled up!<br><br>We had balloons which were &#39;18&#39; that we wanted to put on the birthday girl&#39;s seat and the employees were very nice about it. We were a big group so I was a little hesitant if one waiter will be able to handle all of us.<br><br>Starting off with the beverages... I got the Iced Mango Drink($6.50) THIS DRINK IS A MUST HAVE... 10STARS FOR THIS DRINK!!<br><br>The waiter then proceeded to get the rest of my friends their drinks and their UNLIMITED free bread with butter. Not sure the exact names of the bread but some are white and some are brown. The BROWN ones are the best in my opinion!! Always a fight to see who get the brown one.<br><br>The wait time was 20-30minutes but it was expected as we were a large group but the unlimited bread complemented the wait time with jokes and story telling between my friends. <br><br>The food all came out at the same time which was good because no one wants their food to get cold while waiting for their friend to get their meal.<br><br>For the main dish I got the Shrimp Bistro($18.50) with shredded cheese on top. AMAZING.... usually people look for the shrimp taste but I rather eat the pasta without the shrimp. The pasta was soooooo creamy and delightful. This has to be the BEST pasta I have every tasted in my entire life.<br><br>After we finished, the employees sang happy birthday to the birthday girl and handed a Cheesecake to her. <br><br>The food did fill me and my friends up... I had to take the left over pasta home.<br><br>Another plus about this place was the waiter split the check between 12people... they have some amazing employees at The Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>HIGHLY recommend this place to everyone and highly recommend the Iced Mango drink and Shrimp Bistro to everyone!! I will be back to this place with friends and family members next time!

The wait is horrible. You watch groups of the same size party come in after you and be seated before you. Wait for food for 45 mins and plates are red hot and food dried out from sitting on line too long. Waitress was pleasant but she was an exception to the rest of the staff we interacted with. <br>Would not recommend for meals only dessert.

I come here a lot. Also have been since I was little. Love all their pastas.(They always make my day.) Their cheesecake is MINDBLOWING!!! Their little &#39;Happy Birthday&#39; song is nice too.<br><br>I personally thought the service was ok. It depends on what and time you go though. Same as with the way the place looks. <br><br>Overall I always enjoy myself here. So, I&#39;all be back soon!
Best burger I&#39;ve ever had in my life !! Not to mention the waiter was super nice and friendly will definitely be back their!!!

This place is gross. Food is awful. Took my son for a mommy and son lunch to celebrate his completion of kindergarten. First they tried to sit is 2 inches from another table. Who wants that?  Then they moved is to a booth and it was FREEZING!!!! I asked for the servers several times to lower the draft coming down on us. After waiting 40 min for our pasta dishes I just asked for the check and for them to pack them to go. We were very unhappy. Once getting our food, both my 6 year old and I were like, &#34; what is this?&#34;  I literally threw it out when we got home and just made a meal myself. I have been going to this restaurant in KoP and DC for years with no problem. Will NEVER go back to this one. The chefs should be ashamed of themselves. Completely disappointed and the food was gross!

3.5 but I&#39;m being generous. This place is a zoo.  It was my first time ever in a Cheesecake Factory, so I didn&#39;t know what to expect.  It was a Sunday and our big family had a lovely gift card we wanted to use, so we tried to be smart and make reservations in advance and come in for an early dinner, but THEY DON&#39;T TAKE RESERVATIONS ON THE WEEKENDS. &#34;Expect an hour long wait time,&#34; they said.  So we waited just over an hour (luckily, part of our family arrived early to &#34;take one for the team&#34; and get on the list and the little buzzy thing) while we came with my 86 year old mother a bit later so she wasn&#39;t too inconvenienced. <br><br>The food itself was fine. We ordered 10 different dishes and no one complained. My coconut shrimp curry thing was pretty good. What was over the top, though, was the service. Our waiter was bouncy and energetic and really happy. Nice to see that on a busy night, he seemed unfazed by all.  Good job, mister.

Yikes! My family comes to the Cheesecake Factory frequently but each visit has slowly decreased our appetite for the restaurant. The menu changes frequently, each time cutting more and more vegetarian options.  We went for a late lunch and alas, there was a wait. We expected as much. <br><br>After being seated, our server came out with water for the table but no straws. I had to actually ask for straws? (Question mark for the incredulous tone of the statement) We were waiting on two more people, so I had asked for the appetizers to be brought out when everyone had arrived but he replied that we would have to wait until everyone was here to order them or we could order them now and he would bring it out when it was ready. I don&#39;t think our request was too complicated but still, unfulfilled. After the rest of the group arrived, we ordered our meals. <br><br>Because the menu had changed since our last visit, my parents asked for the vegetarian dishes (my mom&#39;s favorite falafel salad was no longer offered), and he said they had 3 vegetarian dishes. Now, I don&#39;t claim to know the entire menu at the CF but I know for a fact that they have more than 3 vegetarian meals. What&#39;s up with that? She decided to order the tomato basil pasta, the vegetarian version. Also, please note that this was an entire conversation, and not a simple Q &amp; A. Our server knows very well that my parents do not eat meat. After some time, he brings the food to the table and doesn&#39;t even notice the empty waters. Once again, we had to ask for more water??? <br><br>Lo and behold, the tomato basil pasta my mother ordered has chicken in it. We flag him down and ask is this chicken? He says yes. He then proceeds to ask if it&#39;s ok that the kitchen remove the chicken and bring the same food back. Personally, I was offended that this even happened in the first place. But then he has the audacity to ask if she wants the same meal, minus the chicken? WTF? It would be one thing if she had asked for the tomato basil pasta without chicken but after the conversation where they asked him for a vegetarian menu and whatnot, it was absolutely unacceptable, and he did not even seem apologetic. Honestly, it feels like he was trying to spite us or something because nothing made sense. I know for a fact that this was the Final visit to the Cheesecake factory.

We have eaten at the Cherry Hill, NJ Cheesecake factory on several occasions. Our visit on Saturday was &#34;EXCEPTIONAL&#34; !<br>Our waitrees, Erica, raised our dining experience to the excellent level.  She was cordial, attentive and professional. Our food was served hot and at the proper intervals.<br>My wife, son, daughter and me thoroughly enjoyed our meals as well as Erica&#39;s superb service.
Just stopped by for some dessert and slices of cheesecake to take home.  Its nice to have this location on the way home from Philly.   I love the place, its one of my favorite restaurants.

One of the better restaurant chains in the United States of A. Expansive menu, elegant decor and consistency in taste, quality and experience. Highly recommend their appetizers, cheesecakes and specialty dishes - chicken Madeira, bang bang chicken and shrimp, chipotle chicken pasta amongst a few.

Why am I reviewing this place? Because I need to pump up my reviews. Why are you reading this? Either your sitting in Cheesecake Factory and waiting for your waitress or you&#39;re really interested in someone&#39;s opinion who you really don&#39;t care about. Either way thanks for reading!<br><br>Stopped by on Saturday around 10:30pm. There was no wait. We got sat immediately. There was a big woman sitting by herself on her phone. To the left of us and a couple making out at the bar. A no name boxing match was on. I will reveal who won the fight (4 time welterweight champion vs some guy, spoiler alert someone got knocked out round 3). <br><br>We got drinks. I got a smashing whiskey something. It was delicious. My wife got a blue moon. Drinks came out very quickly.<br><br>We skipped appetizers and went right in for the kill. Unfortunately even with no crowd the wait time for our food was 30+ minutes. Do not go here if you are in a rush. <br><br>I got the steak Diane and chicken medeina which is apparently their favorite dish as a combo. My wife got the chicken parm pizza lol. The calories weren&#39;t listed because in sure listing a 3500 calorie bomb should be illegal. Mine was good. Steak was perfectly cooked and the chicken was moist. I like the cheese on top. When the mashed potatoes with the skin were to die for.<br><br>The waitress never asked if we wanted a second drink. Oh well her loss!<br><br>When we finished I couldn&#39;t find my waitress. We waited another 20 minutes before she emerged. I asked for a check and a box for the remaining 2/3 of the chicken parm pizza (which was essentially a huge patty of chicken covered in pizza sauce with some noods on top). <br><br>She asked if we wanted dessert and oh yeah we&#39;re at the Cheesecake Factory! I ordered the classic with the cherry preserves with some ice cream. It came out with two dollops of whipped cream! I totally forgot! Too much cream. I&#39;m lactose intolerant. I would regret this choice. <br><br>Bill came out to $68. Not bad. If we didn&#39;t order drinks we&#39;d have been okay. At least we shared dessert! Still working off those calories. The waitress took another 10 minutes to come over after we finished dessert. She immediately got the check then walked away (should&#39;ve waited the 3 seconds for me to give her my cc) 20 minutes go by and I finally see her chatting up another waiter. I literally need to waive the check bill in the air to flag her down before she realizes I&#39;m ready. <br><br>We leave by 12:10am. Could&#39;ve been done in 30 minutes but I could never find the waitress. That is why they get a 3 star rating rather than 5. Other times they have been way quicker.<br><br>The boxer won by knockout in the first 3 rounds. He essentially won before our food came out! Also when we left the big lady was still texting with her empty plates in front of her! Must&#39;ve been one intense text sesh.

So, at lunchtime around 130pm, the parking lot is packed. No way time really though. Our waiter,  Eric was decent. Friendly and not overly attentive. I was disappointed that they didn&#39;t have Rolling Rock beer though. The waitstaff here are helpful to one another and working in retail, I&#39;m big on customer service and even how the employees treat one another.. While Eric was waiting other tables, another server noticed my empty salad bowl and asked if she could take it.  <br><br>Onto the food.. I ordered a Caesar salad and a lunch portion  of a rigatoni dish with shrimp and sausage. One thing I HATE about a predressed salad is almost no dressing or too much dressing. This salad nailed it spot on.. Just enough without being watery or soggy.  However, this dressing tasted more like mayonnaise with pepper. Wasn&#39;t a big fan but a little table salt and freshly cracked pepper saved my soul. Up next was my lunch portion of rigatoni with shrimp and sausage. Pretty tasty. Overall, I enjoyed the food and ambience but it&#39;s not a restaurant I&#39;d wait in line for an hour to get a table. I&#39;ll try some dessert next time.

We always enjoy our visits to the Cheesecake Factory, but I will admit we have to be in a certain frame of mind for it.  It&#39;s a very busy, loud, noisy, crowded place and frankly, the noise and chaos grate on our nerves and gives us indigestion.  As others have mentioned, if you go at prime meal times, there is almost always a wait.  This restaurant is steadily busy ALL the time, even on off hours, although on off hours you might not have a long wait.  They don&#39;t take reservations, either, which is a pain.<br><br>On the plus side, the food is very tasty, portions are generous and service is usually friendly and attentive.  I love all the varieties of cheesecakes offered, and the cheesecake is pretty good - maybe a little on the dense/dry side for my taste, but still good.  I think the most appealing thing about their cheesecake is that huge number of varieties available.  One of my favorite desserts they serve is not a cheesecake at all - it is the strawberry shortcake (see my photo).  It&#39;s a biscuit shortcake piled high with vanilla ice cream, strawberries and whipped cream and it&#39;s the bomb.  Be aware - this dessert HUGE and can easily feed 3 people.<br><br>I also love the Fried Mac &amp; Cheese and Avocado Egg Roll Appetizers.  For entrees, my favorite is the Bistro Shrimp Pasta.<br><br>All in all, I give this restaurant thumbs up!

I used to visit this Cheesecake Factory years ago and it was good! Last night my fiancé and I decided to go because we had a gift card. Our waitress was super friendly and sweet. Our cocktails were yummy. My mojito was delicious. The food though... terrible. Greasy appetizers. My pasta dish was horrible that I ate 2 bites and was done. Nothing had flavor and the pasta was cooked for too long. The shrimp had zero flavor. I told the waitress and got it removed from our bill. We got cheesecakes and they were alright. This place is going downhill. The food isn&#39;t great. Everything is greasy and too much garlic.

About a 40 minutes wait on a Saturday night I guess isn&#39;t too bad. They were also giving out samples for their holiday Peppermint Cheesecake.<br><br>Fooood time!<br><br>For starters:<br>&#39; Buffalo wings<br>&#39; Crispy Crab Bites<br>&#39; Stuffed Mushrooms<br><br>The Stuffed Mushrooms had a Garlic and Herbs in a Wine Sauce which was good to dip with the complimentary bread that they gave you.<br>*Side story: About that bread, I love it! The brown one. We even got another basket with just the brown ones. And when we were almost done, we asked for some more so our waiter went and got us a whole fresh roll! I was so excited! Thank you!!<br><br>So for the main course, we had:<br>&#39; Cajun Jambalaya<br>&#39; Shrimp with Angel Hair<br>&#39; Farfalle with Chicken &amp; Roasted Garlic<br>&amp; some kind of chicken salad with blue cheese.<br><br>Jamabalaya = &#34;Shrimp and Chicken Sautéed with Onions, Tomato and Peppers in a Very Spicy Cajun Sauce.&#34; I wouldn&#39;t say it was VERY spicy but it was a little.<br>I felt like the angel hair was a bit bland so we mix the jamabalaya &amp; the angel hair pasta and you get a nice new little pasta dish with more taste.<br><br>For dessert:<br>&#39; Fresh Strawberry Cheesecake<br>&#39; Mango Key Lime Cheesecake<br>&#39; Pumpkin Cheesecake<br><br>The Mango Key Lime was pretty good. I didn&#39;t try the rest but everyone seemed to enjoy it.<br><br>We&#39;ll be back. I&#39;ll be back for the bread but I&#39;m sure everyone else will be back for the food &amp; cheesecake.

If I could do a 0 I would. Super unhappy w the service. Mac n cheese balls tasted worst than my ex husbands dirty human balls. Very very very very very very disappointed, don&#39;t even waste your time going to this factory. It&#39;s awful.

The cheesecake factory is one of the best places that I&#39;ve ever eaten I go there at least once a week if I possibly can I love it there I love the food I love the atmosphere I love the service I love everything about the cheesecake factory. It&#39;s a shame that other places don&#39;t have a clue maybe they should get a job at the cheesecake factory to find out how to please the customers. The cheesecake factory will always be my go to place because I know the menu is great

The portions are huge not as large as the wait though. I find the menu overwhelming. The bread basket that comes out with a variety of breads is nice especially with the butter. Being the menu is so large I make up my mind and then change it 3 or 4 times before the servers makes it back. The cocktails are not anything special. The cheesecake options are always promising. I love cheesecake so it&#39;s pretty hard to mess that up in my opinion. I don&#39;t find myself craving the food that often and mostly it&#39;s due to the wait the food is not worth waiting 1.5 to be seated. I usually go with the ceasar salad which is HUGE and well dressed. Their margaritas leave much to be desired flavor wise but are pretty strong. <br><br>Also, I tried arranging a dinner with a large group and they do not take reservations so I decided to wait the 2 hours they asked me to wait in order to put together a table large enough for us all but then they changed their minds once I arrived and we had to go elsewhere. They should take reservations for larger groups (like most  other restaurants) but is evident they didn&#39;t want our money then therefore I take my money elsewhere on other nights.

This is the worst Cheesecake Factory location I have ever been to.  I used to love this chain and felt that they had reliably good food.  At the Cherry Hill location, the food was just inedible, restaurant itself was unsanitary, and the bad service did not help either.  My cousin and I came for lunch on Thursday 7/13 at around 3pm.  The restaurant was nowhere near full and it appeared that most tables were available.  We were told by the hostess that it would be a 20 minute wait if we want to have a table with service (??there is an option for table without service??), otherwise we could go sit at the bar.  We browsed around at nearby shops and waited the 20 minutes... When we got buzzed for a table, we were seated in the far corner of the restaurant (awkward spot where there were A LOT OF FLIES!!! EW) and on our way to the table, there were so many empty tables that had not been cleared/cleaned (this could be what is attracting flies? and causing a wait at an off hour?).  I ordered the Louisiana chicken pasta... and it was so terrible... it was pasta floating in so much oil that I caught myself SLURPING the three bites that I took!  I ended up just eating the chicken cutlet part of it.  My cousin got an everything pizza... and it looked and tasted like a frozen pizza that was not microwaved all the way! The cheese looked like individual shredded pieces that did not melt... and I heard loud crunching as she bit into the crust (which was not &#34;crispy&#34; but more from being stale).  Our waitress was so hard to get a hold of and with all the flies, we were just anxious to get out of there.  She never made eye contact or asked how our food was, just dropped off the check and walked away quickly.  I will not be returning to this location and certainly do NOT recommend.

Whose not a fan of The Cheesecake Factory?? This has always been a place I visit at the end of my day, trying to always avoid the crowd. I luv their mojito&#39;s and they have a pretty large selection of vegetarian food. Not, just the typical vegetarian meals, but something that took some thought to create.<br><br>On this visit, my daughter and I came in an hour before closing. I started with my usual pineapple mojito but ended up with two by the end of the night. I decided it was to late to eat a large meal, so I stuck with the small plate menu. I was craving a Greek salad, and it truly can&#39;t be appreciated unless you add extra feta cheese, YUM!! I also enjoyed a variety of fried sticks, that included zucchini, avocado and port mushrooms. All fried to perfection with two dipping sauces, I was in veggie heaven.<br><br>Overall, this was a very healthy and inexpensive meal. The customer service was great and we opted to sit outside, since the AC was blasting. I luv getting those little moments alone with my daughter, she&#39;s the best company. I&#39;m a regular here, so I&#39;ll always be back!!

I haven&#39;t been much of a Cheesecake Factory fan, but I went for brunch &amp; I may be changing my mind. I had the California Omelette &amp; Brûlée French toast which was delicious. The french toast was nicely toasted on the outside with a soft melt-on-your-tongue center. I also tasted the Crab Hash which was very tasty. The crab meat was perfectly flavored &amp; paired very well with the poached eggs &amp; potatoes. I can now add the Cheesecake Factory to my list of places that serve a good brunch ;-)

I love the cheesecake factory.  It has been a good go to restaurant every since I was a teenager.  There is something for everyone on the menu and a wide variety of food.  Service can be a hit or miss depending on how busy they are but the food has always been delicious.  I recommend checking out the happy hour.  The happy hour menu is much larger then most restaurants.

I mean no need for a long review.<br>Every single time I am here IT IS JUST AMAZING<br><br>The atmosphere is great! The food is always fresh EVEN A TOGO.. Its such a clean atmosphere... <br><br>The food I MEAN UGHHHHHH ... Its just great..

Must say, cheesecake phenomenal, drinks are good, service below average. Had a few drinks with my sister and brother in law but majority of the time was sat waiting for a refill and 25 minutes to pay our bill. The bartenders were very unattentive, and it was like we were unnoticed when needed to order or pay. I love the food and drinks just the service was frustrating.

Worst customer service i&#39;ve ever witnessed.. i like giving restaurants the benefit of the doubt as i&#39;ve been in the industry for quite some years and understand the in&#39;s and out&#39;s of the job better than others.. but wow no words.<br><br>I came back a total of 2 more times after the first horrible experience in order to give it a fair review in hopes that my server was just having a bad day that time, but it only got worse.<br><br>The last time in particular, the server had given me nachos with chicken when i asked for without, no big deal. I told him i wouldn&#39;t mind eating it but I don&#39;t feel comfortable paying for something i did not ask for, he huffed and said nothing, only removed the plate from the table. Came back 10 min later and said you won&#39;t be charged and practically threw the plate down and walked away.<br><br>No apology.. nothing. Me and my husband just sat there and ate the cold nachos. This was only the beginning of the rather eventful night to say the least. Never was checked up on.. had to search him down for another round of drinks.. and much more, unfortunately.<br><br>Sad because i&#39;ve always loved the food.. but the service is what will assure me that I will not be coming back any time soon.

Sometimes I get take-out cheesecake but order two slices instead of just the one I want so the cashier thinks I&#39;m nice (getting cheesecake for someone else) and that I have company waiting to eat cheesecake with me at home around 10 pm on Saturday night. <br><br>Luckily the cashiers will never be able to distinguish between times when I&#39;m doing the above and times when I&#39;m ACTUALLY getting two pieces for myself AND another ACTUAL person. I may never order two for myself again anyway so if I come back and order two slices most likely the second one isn&#39;t for me.<br><br>I want to add that it would be nice if the lovely faces which are painted on the tops of the columns inside the restaurant were lowered. It might be hard to lower them since they seem permanently cemented to the ceiling but I think it&#39;s worth it if you ask me. If they were lowered to eye level it&#39;d create this illusion of more people dining which would make the atmosphere a bit warmer and frankly a bit more exciting. There is always the risk of neck injury with &#39;doing a double-take&#39; as they say which could present as a problem if people are now constantly doing &#39;double-takes.&#39; What I&#39;m saying is if the painted faces were lower the likelihood of people thinking someone is staring at them might be higher which means their likelihood of quickly doing a &#39;double-take&#39; only to find out it is a painting of a face rather than a real human face staring at them (if you can even say that) would be higher which may lead to a higher likelihood of neck or other injury. The last thing I&#39;d want for the CF would be a lawsuit for such an injury. Maybe we should keep the faces where they are.<br><br>I will just continue my &#39;double-take&#39; of cheesecake for which I haven&#39;t sustained an injury other than to my ego but that was in the past. I will admit I&#39;m also concerned for my arteries but that is an injury for the future. Let me summarize: presently no injury is taking place. Like I said from now on I&#39;ll buy cheesecake for myself (1 piece) and another person who definitely has a real human face and therefore mouth to eat the cake with (another 1 piece). <br><br>Oh yes the cake is very good.

A Saturday dinner with family, surprise seating times by 25 min . Service by nice server she bring drinks and fresh breads with butter very fast.  Ahi Tuna with Wasabi butter sauce taste amazing , 100% love it . My family ordered different food. They also like it and we have no more room for Cheesecake. Maybe next time come here only for cheesecake. Nice place for dinner.

I was here last night on a Saturday in December during holiday shopping season.<br><br>As expected, there was a long wait, but we were seated before the estimated wait time.<br><br>The hostess and server were very friendly. The food came out much quicker than anticipated given the hectic conditions.<br><br>The menu is a little crazy considering the types of food they offer. I don&#39;t know what you&#39;d consider their &#34;specialty&#34;. I got the Spicy Cashew Chicken and it was tasty, so that&#39;s all that matters!
Delicious food of course great service I had spaghetti nothing like the one I make.Good drinks <br>Must try the original cheese cake they have <br>A little pricey but well worth it

Was planning on taking my party of nine to have a casual birthday dinner.  I attempted to call early in the week to get a reservation since the party was large, however, they stated they didn&#39;t take reservations.  hmmmm... so went there in-person the day of and was told it was over a 1.5 hour wait.  Seriously?!?! So you don&#39;t take reservations, and if you come in person you have to wait that long.  One-star for not having weekend reservations set up.  Just because you KNOW that you have enough business to not have to deal with reservations doesn&#39;t mean you degrade the customer experience in such a manner.  Instead we went across the street to get AYCE sushi instead and had an amazing dinner.

The front service host named Robert was extremely rude to our party. When approached with a question of a possible party change he confronted us with an attitude. From 1 hour and a half to a 3 hour wait. For what? Because I said maybe there will be another person. Mind you, this person is one hour away and the guest joining our party arrival was still in question. Yet he went and added another guest to the party. Extremely rude, did not enjoy our night. We were here to celebrate a birthday, but this cheesecake will no longer be receiving our service.

I kinda dig this place after 3 visits. I always thought you had to dress up or at least be somewhat casual but you can come as you are, just don&#39;t show up in pajamas or something ridiculous. The food was extremely hot and the bread basket I demolished. Service here is always great and I never regret traveling to this location.

Pretty good. Though there is so much on the menu, and it can sometimes be hard to choose, the food is satisfactory. The atmosphere is nice, service was good, and food was yummy. The food took a little while to come and was a little pricey, but it was worth it. I recommend the Four Cheese Pasta.

Today, there was good parking spot! We got a good seat fast. It was lunchtime and I order a salad . The chicken seem like it wasn&#39;t cooked done  but the salad was good. I also got a carrot cake it&#39;s okay . The staff was okay and it&#39;s clean. I&#39;ll recommend this to anyone who want some good food and drinks are okay. Thanks for the fast food, I was hungry and this ain&#39;t my first here.

Great exterior. As well as restaurant. Service could be better with the food coming out waiting times. But The Cheesecake Factory is one of my go too&#39;s. Awesome food place. I love their Strawberry Lemonade as well.

After standing for over 1 hour for a table and people that came in after us were able to sit, we finally got a table. The air was blow straight down on us on one side. <br>As for the meal we got wings, nachos,  and burgers which were all good. Cheesecake was very good also. Just wont be back for the long wait.

The only thing good about this place is the cheesecake. I came here at 7pm on a Wednesday, ordered one slice of cheesecake, and for some reason did not receive my one slice of cheesecake until 7:50pm. I didn&#39;t realize that putting in a slice of cheesecake took almost an hour. You&#39;d think if I didn&#39;t order any entree, I&#39;d want my cheesecake at the same time as everyone else. I&#39;ll stick with ordering my cake to-go next time. That white chocolate raspberry truffle always has me coming back to this terrible place.

Let me start this review with we ended up at Chili&#39;s bc they always do me right. <br>My husband &amp; I initially went to cheesecake bc I wanted their nachos (super good) &amp; we waited for an hour (poor hungry husband) got seated, the server (Jamal) got us water, then when he came back took the order for our food &amp; asked if we wanted the bread as we waited, I said helllll yeahhh. Well I said &#34;yes pls.&#34; 15-20 mins later people got seated RIGHT next to us. As soon as they sat down Jamal came &amp; put down the bread then said &#34;hey girl, how you been??&#34; So obv they were friends. Then took their drink order. I waited 5 more mins to see if he would bring us our bread &amp; he didn&#39;t. So I went to the manager &amp; told him what happened. It&#39;s fine if you&#39;re talking with your friends, but you&#39;re also at work. &amp; if you see your friends I know you can see us bc we are sitting less than a foot from them. The manager said he would come bring us bread &amp; check on our food. Some random servers come to bring us our actual food, then the manager comes out with the bread, but they ran out of the brown bread (ofc my fav. but the table next to us had brown bread which should have been mine #salty) so the manager said he would come bring us brown bread when more was made. They walk away &amp; I realize my nachos don&#39;t have chicken on them &amp; I ordered chicken. The manager comes to ask how everything is &amp; I tell him my nachos have no chicken. 5 mins later the server comes back &amp; there&#39;s just chunks of shredded chicken on my nachos. He leaves &amp; I realize there is no guacamole with my nachos. I ordered guacamole. So I wait for him to come back &amp; I ask him &#34;isn&#39;t this suppose to come with guacamole?&#34; He goes &#34;yeah usually, do you want me to go get it?&#34; I say &#34;no, just take it back &amp; take it off my bill&#34; he says &#34;okay, np&#34; then the manager comes back with the nachos &amp; goes &#34;we have taken this off your bill, you can have them for free&#34; I said &#34;no, you can take it back. It&#39;s apparent these nachos were the first ones that were brought out to me 20 mins ago. I don&#39;t want them. Can we get a box &amp; a check?&#34; He says &#34;yes&#34; now update on my husband, he is loving his food. He told me how bomb it was but as soon as the server leaves he goes &#34;I&#39;m not taking this babe, we will go somewhere else, if they give it to us for free I&#39;ll take it but otherwise no&#34; so the server comes back &amp; hands me the check. THEY&#39;RE REALLY TRYING TO CHARGE ME FOR HIS FOOD. Like no 10% discount. No free dessert. Nothing. So my husband could tell I was livid &amp; he tells the server &#34;look, I&#39;m not taking this food &amp; we aren&#39;t paying this bill. We are going to have to go somewhere else to eat anyways. I&#39;m not eating this food in front of her. This experience has been awful&#34; the server goes &#34;okay, yeah, no problem, have a good night&#34; like wtf. Worst experience ever. 0/10. Would not recommend. &amp; that&#39;s how we ended up at chili&#39;s.

I don&#39;t know what is going on with this place lately. I never in all the years I&#39;ve been going here have I had a bad experience and the last 2x it&#39;s been terrible. I&#39;m wondering if they hired a new chef or under new management but I was there 2 weeks ago and they give us rock hard stale bread and the waiter says oh I can get you new bread but it prob won&#39;t be any better  seriously? Then I went again last night and same thing. The food was not good. I hope this isn&#39;t going to be a regular thing now. So disappointing

The bitch that answered the phone was rude as fuck. She hung up on me when we were just asking if they did call ahead seating. I hope she gets fired. She&#39;s rude and shouldn&#39;t be working there. If I could give 0 stars I would.

Went here on Super Bowl Sunday to talk about the Bachelor, and despite the restaurant being empty we were sat shoulder to shoulder with other guests. Chicken teriyaki was whatever, avocado egg roll was decent, my date had gumbo after ordering salmon and having them coming back saying they were out (who does that?) and even though she&#39;s gorgeous she didn&#39;t look to happy with it. Bartender was super nice, but for the price of 4 shots of Don Julio you could just buy a bottle at your local liquor selling establishment.  <br><br>Ps-one of the couples next to use was using sign language and boy having that out of the corner of your eye is distracting. Move those tables apart Cheesecake Factory!!!

I love this place the food was delicious, the Lasagna was well cook the employees was very friendly and helpful , I would definitely be back here. I recommend this place if you have in mind bringing your family I recommend this restaurant .

I would give this place zero stars if i could. <br>Went here for my boyfriends birthday - party of 8.<br>Once sat down, drinks were ordered and given to us. <br>Took over an hour to get our food, we actually ended up leaving before our food was brought to us for the simple fact people who were seated AFTER us were already served their food. Manager was no help, just kept saying sorry and that it will be 2 more minutes. Our food never came. Never had this issue with any restaurant. This was ridiculous. <br>Our party ended up going somewhere else and my boyfriends birthday dinner was ruined.

This review has 2 stars because the waitress was super friendly. Now for the bad:<br>1) Bone in chicken parm pizza special. <br>2) the entree I got wasn&#39;t good or really what I asked for<br>3) everything was extremely slow
