We had such a bad experience with Cheesecake Factory in Cherry Hill, NJ last night.  <br>Utensils and the plate settings were given to us 10 minutes after our Appetizers were brought out to the table. <br>Our food came out 45 minutes late. The manager came up with some ridiculous excuse for our food  coming out of the kitchen so late. One of my son&#39;s Pasta da Vinci was so dry, our Tex mix egg rolls were over fried. <br>We have been to many other Cheesecake Factory before, from Pasadena, Glendale, marina delray to Philadelphia, Delaware and Maryland. We never experienced such bad service.

My mother-in-law called to make a reservation for 17 people at 6:30pm. She was told she could not make a reservation for that time, reason being is because schools are having graduation parties and it would be to late for a reservation. And she called Brio and they were more than happy to accommodate. The next time we have a party The Cheesecake Factory will not be on our list of places to go.

It was a busy Saturday night so I understand that things will be busy and chaotic.  After an expected 30 minute wait for a table, I ordered the classic bang bang chicken and shrimp.  Being a busy night, it took almost an hour for the food to arrive...but I again understand.  The problem was, my chicken and shrimp arrived SANS chicken!  It was pretty obvious too since the plate consisted of a mound of rice with a few shrimp and sauce.  It was clearly half the normal portion.<br><br>After letting the waitress know, she was very friendly and offered to correct the issue.  Apparently though, my order went to the very back of the line again since it took about another 45 minutes before I received my corrected order.  By the time I got my food, the rest of my party was finished eating and ready to go.  So let&#39;s hope the food tastes okay reheated since my dinner out involved picking scraps of food from the rest of my party.  <br><br>The manager did come by to say &#34;Sorry about how long it&#39;s taking.  The kitchen is very busy tonight&#34;.  While I don&#39;t expect the manager to give free food because mistakes do happen...but ANYTHING, even an appetizer or more bread would have been nice...rather than begging for leftovers from my companions.  The scraps of food I had were tasty though and our waitress was very friendly.   Manager definitely could have handled the situation better considering after around two hours waiting, I never did get to eat what I ordered.<br><br>Update:  While my experience with this location was lackluster...I have to say that Cheesecake Factory corporate did an excellent job.  The Guest Relations Department with corporate read my review and contacted me right away.  They apologized and asked for additional details to allow them to investigate the problem to prevent such occurrences from happening to others.  The fact that they actually read online reviews and address potential issues is impressive.

It&#39;s always a hit and miss with this location. While I love going here and just sitting at the Hi Tops and ordering apps and drinks with friends, I find they usually screw up every other time. It&#39;s mainly the kitchen, you either get a chef who can cook or you get a chef who just doesn&#39;t get it. We never try to customize our food orders because the menu is so extensive that you can find something that fits your palette without a problem. Yesterday after a business meeting we decided to visit CF before heading home. I ordered my usual Basil, Tomato and Cheese flat bread and opted to try 2 new things: the cucumber mint lemonade (amazing!) and the parmesan cheesey garlic bread (fail! There was no cheese at all on there). Sent the garlic bread back and just asked for an order of fries. <br><br>Just a note about their French toast for brunch. Just say no! Or go to Grand Lux across the street. Their French toast is horrible. I needed a steak knife to cut it! Not cool! They don&#39;t use proper bread for french toast it&#39;s more like a hard shell sourdough. <br><br>For every good meal I have at CF there is always one where their kitchen screws something up. They need new chefs. Consistency is key.
They messed up a simple order of Tiramisu take home on a Valentine Day Called the manager and they offered that it may look like a mush but will taste good. Really ?

After a long day at the Adventure Aquarium we were exhausted and couldn&#39;t wait to have a great dinner.  We arrived and were seated right away by very friendly hostesses.  We sat down anxiously awaiting for our drink orders to be taken and much to our disappointment it took the waiter over 10 minutes to get to us.  He was very polite and finally took our order and then we didn&#39;t see him again for another 5-6 minutes.  He brought our drinks, but no bread.  It was still baking.  We ordered our food and about another 5 minutes passed and the bread came.  Delicious.  Soft, fresh, softened butter.  Highly satisfying - especially since we had been seated for almost a half hour at this point.  About 20 minutes later our food came out...  in drips and drabs.  The plates were so hot they couldn&#39;t be touched, which tells me they sat under the heat lamps for a while before the runners got to them.  The stuffed mushrooms came out in a broth that  resembled soup.  They tasted great but we&#39;re not cooked long enough to reduce the sauce.  The chicken littles are great, HUGE portion (11 strips) and cooked perfectly.  Only complaint is that they are supposed to have a Cajun flavoring to them, which isn&#39;t noticeable at all.  The BBQ sauce makes up for it though - delicious! The Chicken Taquerias were also very good and do have a bit of spice to them.  The kids pasta Alfredo left something to be desired.  Tasted very milky.  The waiter never came back to check on us or refill drinks.  We waited for about 10 minutes after finishing our meals for him to resurface. We paid the bill and went to the restroom before leaving.  Very messy and not well attended to.  Both stalls were out or low on toilet paper.  The sink area was covered in water and the smell wasn&#39;t pleasant.  Overall if good food and huge portions are what your looking for, this is a great choice.  But if you&#39;re looking for the overall experience, beware, because the staff and facilities leave something to be desired.

I&#39;ve been the cheesesteak factory before in the king of prussia mall, PA as well as in tyson&#39;s corner ,VA..... this location just isn&#39;t as good. <br><br>The tuna tartare was the best thing. It&#39;s under the Apps. <br><br>For my entree I got the chicken carbonara, pretty good. For some reason I just think the other locations have better cooks or something. The service was good here but the taste of the food was a bit off.

Went for lunch for a family members birthday and it was absolutely delicious! Their skinny menu is fabulous and their low cal steak medallions- with edamame instead of mashed potatoes- was off the charts, only downside was the wait for a table and wait for food

Estimated 45 Min wait. It took an hour and 45 min to be seated. I started checking in after the first hour and we were told &#34;only a few more minutes&#34; about 6x. I&#39;m sorry but that&#39;s absurd. I wouldn&#39;t have stuck around if I knew it would have taken that long. <br>Food was fair. It took 20 min to get drinks and after the hr and 45 min wait I was in need of a good cocktail. Cosmo was 95% cranberry juice. FAIL. The whole experience was horrible. I&#39;ll never go back. 4 hours of my life I&#39;ll never get back.

Good food keeps me coming back. <br>Albeit service has been spotty. Last two visits we didn&#39;t receive the right order. This most recent visit, as an example, our server&#39;s response to the situation was &#34;I work with idiots&#34; no apologies at all. Just took my dish to the back and added the missing ingredient while repeating &#34; I work with idiots &#34;. Extremely unpleasant. More customer service trading needed !

My absolute favorite restaurant. Great service and a nice atmosphere every time. I get the Lemon Garlic Shrimp every single time I&#39;m there because I literally cannot tear away from it. I tell everyone that it would be my last meal on death row. Best meal and it gets better every time. Also, obviously the Cheesecake is phenomenal (I love the fresh strawberry one!). Just fantastic time and time again

Yea 5 stars for a chain location... <br>I brought my wife here Sunday night for an early anniversary dinner(seeing on Tuesday i am at an interview) We have eaten at their other location in King Of Prussia and i must say seeing this is the second time.. no complaints..<br><br>We had outside seating seeing the weather was Gorgeous and the wait time was 1 min, compaired to 15-20 min for inside dining. Which is common for this place, also its not as cold as it was inside.. felt like a cold box once you walked in. My wife as much as i LOVE her she is always cold.. it could be 85 outside and she can still complain about it being cold.. Don&#39;t know its her Latino blood.. but thats besides. The outside was perfect, light breeze, beautiful scenerie.. a look of the stores and how it was lit up by the lights and florals outside. (Not saying inside was bad, that too looked comfortable, easy on the eyes)<br><br>Our service was great, our waitress was friendly recommended some specials there were doing. They also have a newer menu out its their 500 calorie or less menu(for those of you who want to enjoy the great food, but not to worry about gaining weight)I saw the menu, i looked over it , i must say i was impressed, the meals they had on there.. you wouldn&#39;t think they were 500 cal, or less.<br><br>OK now lets get into the goods... <br><br>We started off with some drinks, wifey got the Pina Colada, i got the Pomegrante Mojito.. (very very good) , our appitzers we both went salads, my wife got the veggi salad,(this is one big salad) and myself a Boston salad.. Lets say Boston won this battle of the salads, very tasty, had bacon on it so you know its a winner hands down, shredded and little chunks of  blue cheese and ranch dressing.. I reccommend that salad if you guys like salads.. <br><br>For our main course, which i gotta say the portions are incredible.. more like HUGE. My wife and i both went with steaks but she had the shrimp scampi with a fillet cut medium, with wasabi mash, and veggies. Looked great , cooked to her likings. Myself i went with the Hibachi steak, medium with tempura asparagas, also wasabi mash, shitake mushrooms in a sweet, but not overbearing sauce.. gotta say they knocked it out of the park with this... Phenominal. <br><br>Our waitress did a great job, made sure if we liked evrything, or any problems.. it did get a little cold outside(for my wife) i enjoyed it... but i did ask if she could turn on the heater they have, she did, without any hesitation or surroundings people. I think the wives/gf&#39;s around us were also grateful of this.. <br><br>We didn&#39;t get any cheesecake  because we were full , but i know she brought home 2 slices, dulce de leche, and a vannilla bean.. do you think i will get a taste.. ERRRRR wrong lol . But we did walk around after the meal to look at the stores .. i recommend that after this feast you will embark

This hit the spot today. Great way to end the day on a high note with a late lunch at Cheesecake Factory. Its as good as i remember it since last time I was here. Went light today so ordered a Sante Fe salad. Nice fresh ingredients, black beans, vorn, and tortilla. I was loving all the fixings in this salad. I really enjoyed this meal!!!!

Came for brunch. The food was pretty good. Surprisingly no wait even though it&#39;s Saturday. It&#39;s pretty much what I would expect from Cheesecake Factory. Food pretty good and excellent service with somewhat cheesy ambiance (no pun intended.$

Unless you want to keep your group or date waiting around for a table, this isn&#39;t a good spot for special occasions nor dates. And yet that&#39;s what virtually Everyone comes here for. Seems logical, i know.<br><br>The decor is nice as usual, but it&#39;s getting a bit dated/run-down from all the hordes of patrons.<br><br>The service is spotty; sometimes you get an energetic smiley server, and sometimes you get an aloof one eager to finish their shift.<br><br>Once the obscene portions of the food are overlooked, the food is actually pretty good. I am a big fan of non-boring flavors-- bitter, sour, pungent, umami, etc. So that narrows the chain&#39;s encyclopedia-sized menu down a bit.<br><br>I recommend any of the cajun, thai, and comfort-style meat dishes for these types of flavors. Some lemon-based Italian dishes too. I say the comfort dishes (shepherds pie, chicken madeira, chicken &amp; biscuits, etc) due to the umami flavor caused by the jus mixed with the starch.. The Mexican-style dishes are mostly Tex-Mex which are not interesting.<br><br>Arguably, only a few cheesecakes are really worth getting: purist related. Original, orig. + strawberries, oreo, vanilla bean, white chocolate rasp, &amp; red velvet. That&#39;s pretty much it. Nothing too complicated, nothing chocolate-centric--if you wanted to cover up the cheesecake flavor, just get sponge cake. <br><br>So that&#39;s my .02...a good place aside from the evening wait times

Love this place. Such a great chain all around. Clean, very friendly and attentive staff and quick service.<br><br>I am aware that this is a chain and sometimes I feel it goes against my nature to review chains and support chains because I feel it necessary to support your local businesspeople! But either way, I came here once with my boyfriend after shopping at Wegmans and it was delightful.  Granted it was at like 3 or 4pm on a weekday so it wasnt busy but the service was excellent, fast and friendly.  The food was amazing.  The fried mac and cheese was out of this world and I just got the quesadillas because I was in the mood for them.  They were delicious as well.  The fact that you have a million different options on that menu is alone a treat.  I would recommend this place for birthdays with family members or large parties like that because everyone can get something they like because the menu is THAT extensive.  For a chain- Cheesecake factory takes the cake (oooooh, get it?!?!?!?)

Long wait but what can you expect at 5:00 pm on a Saturday night?  Absolutely delicious dinner, cooked to perfection but top that off with fantastic service from a young server named &#34;Will&#34; and you have a great dining experience!  Too bad every good restaurant can&#39;t have a few &#34;Wills&#34; because he&#39;s the one who sets the tone for an enjoyable dinner!
The good place to go for any occasion the service was good the food was and of course the cheesecake there is good the burrito I had was good I would definitely go again

Awful service. I purchased the children&#39;s pasta. I told the waiter it was very hard. He brought over the manager. He agreed it was very hard. I asked for it to be taken off, they did so, only after asking. We waited so long for our checks. Our waiters switched mid service. We were asked to tip both waiters. The first sat us down only. We sat for 45 minutes waiting for basic food items. Very very poor service.

There&#39;s nothing wrong with this place, but I am not a Cheesecake Factory fan.<br><br>My daughter and I had dined in one in Baltimore a couple years back.  We were totally unimpressed.  My wife has wanted to go, but after our review, she&#39;s been a bit gun-shy.  We visited here when we realized we were kind of trapped in the area for some time and were hungry.  <br><br>The menu in this place is entirely too large.  There is no reason to have so many selections.  This tells me they want to cater to everyone, but excel at none.  And that pretty much sums this place up.<br><br>This was a better experience than the Baltimore store, but the food is very generic and nothing I would ever say, &#34;Hey, you have to have this dish.&#34;  You can visit and find something that isn&#39;t horrible and overpay for it.  Other than that, I&#39;ll pass from now on.

Host was very rude, unreasonable and extremely unprofessional. Robert has terrible customer service when we asked to simply add one more person to our table he added an additional 2 hours to our wait time. When I asked for explanation and chance to change our table situation he had an attitude and told me to relax..I don&#39;t know who trained their employees on positive customer service skills but there were none. Disappointing to say the least.

Don&#39;t come on a Sunday. I was told a 30 to 40 minute wait..........more like on 2 hours now. ‍ Also I didn&#39;t know you could make reservations.....when did that start? There was a whole section blocked off for a party. I will make reservations next time. ‍

excellent execution for all three entrees ordered ! the bacon cheeseburger, the chicken and shrimp gumbo and the huevos rancheros !!!!!!cant go wromg with anything on their menu! the gumbo sautee was perfectly cooked moist tender pieces of chicken and shrimp they too were moist and cooked perfectly.
Good food and drinks. Had the wrong dish delivered to me and before I could mention it the server was there and corrected my order. Staff was great and service better.

i think it&#39;s safe to say that Cheesecake factories are busy and a wait is expected when you come in.  With that being said, our last visit was actually a pleasant surprise.  Our party of 5 came in for sunday brunch and *gasp* no wait.  All of the food was good, i cant remember what everyone ordered but my meal was the GREEN CHILAQUILES WITH CARNITAS AND EGGS.  It was delish and pretty big- honestly a two person meal.  My husband ordered the chorizo and avocado omelet and it was really good and on the bigger side too.  Our niece ordered the kids mac and cheese and it was tasty! <br><br>If you decide to visit i definitely recommend the sunday brunch and the cucumber mint lemonade.

Oh cheesecake factory, you are like my standard go to little black dress when I&#39;m not really sure what I want to wear, that I can just pull out of my closet in a pinch and still look fab!<br><br>I&#39;ve been to the cherry hill cheesecake factory multiple times.  Now- for any of you who know anything about the cheesecake factory, you can expect a wait when you go during prime times. Off hours the wait time is not bad at all, particularly for late night bites. <br><br>Drinks can be a little expensive ( draft beers run ~$8)/ but cocktails are fresh and usually pretty good. The menu is HUGE. You can get jut about whatever type of continental food you would like to order. I feel like I am never disappointed. The staff is courteous and friendly. Your meal always starts with delicious fresh bread (pumpernickel and white).<br><br>And then of course the dessert, I usually don&#39;t even like cheesecake but give in and order while I&#39;m here. <br><br>A great standard go-to in south jersey when you are really not sure where to go.

Terrible service.   The server never asked if we wanted drink refills.  The server basically ignored us.    The food was subpar to say the least.<br><br>This was my second time to the cheesecake factory,  and sadly this experience was worse than the first. <br><br>I won&#39;t go back.

Food was as expected. It was not bad. Fish tacos were good, my shrimp with angel hair pasta with marinara sauce was good... A little bit on the spicy side but still good. I ordered he dinner portion even though there was a lunch portion available for $3 less. I ordered the dinner portion cuz the waitress said most people can&#39;t finish it and they take home the left overs. I did not have any left overs. Either my appetite has increased or the portion wasn&#39;t anything humongous.  The hibachi steak was sweet and yummy and the pasta with white sauce was good as well.
Absolutely LOVE this place, always my to go place for a nice night out with family!! Zack was great! The Herb Crusted Salmon is awesome! The Pasta Da Vinci as well!!

Service was excellent, great team work led by Ryan.  Ryan was on top of things . Did not miss a beat. The requests were delivered without waiting and wondering when they will serve. They fill our drinks without asking. Same with Ben, refill the bread with lots of butter. Food was ok. Chowder needs to be thicken a little bit. Overall the good was ok. Thanks Ryan and ben

I find the appetizers I ordered are filling. The crispy wontons &amp; spicy crispy chicken taquitos... But, ohhhh the cheesecake.....<br><br>This place is a sin just walking through the door but who cares with all their delicious food and dessert. But if you feel too guilty they have a Skinny Girl menu.......

Jan 18, 2018 we went to this location for dinner.   When we were seated, we didn&#39;t have enough menus and waited for our  waitress to come which took a little longer.   Bottom line is  that she wasn&#39;t attentive at all and when paying my Bill, she got the nerves to circle the receipt like she did a outstanding job.

Just got back from eating dinner here with a friend. We specifically asked to be seated in a spot that was less loud than the rest of the place. We were sat at an end table by a window but when the mother and her 10 year old kids came to sit..they were obnoxious..cursing..not sitting.. yelling and the mother did nothing. I went to the front desk to tell them about the nuisance and they just said sorry. I then found the waitress and told her and she also said sorry. When I asked if our seats could be moved, she said no because it was too crowded. No body offered to move us, I had to ask. My friend and I couldnt have a conversation because they were so loud and inappropriate. We told the waitress we have to take our desserts to go because it was too loud. Nobody offered to discount our meal or comp the desserts at least. On way out, we asked for manager and told him and he apologized like 5 times yet didn&#39;t offer coupons or any incentive to return. All he said was ask for him next time and when I said there wont be a next time he didn&#39;t say anything. Managers shouldnt put customers on the spot by saying &#34;what can I do to fix this.&#34; They should already know and just do it. Ridiculous management.

Always a little wait when going to this location, but nothing major. One of my favorite restaurants. Food is always awesome! My go to is the chicken Little&#39;s or buffalo blast as an appetizer. The Tex mex egg rolls are also good as an appetizer. Overall, I never have any complaints with The Cheesecake Factory !

It took forty five minutes to get our food, my daughter&#39;s tacos were cold, and my husband&#39;s fries were cold. The lemonade apparently was very good though. My baked potato soup was just average. The waitress was good.

The Cheesecake Factory has a lot of different cheesecake. When you coming in to the Restaurant your eyes go straight to the Cheesecake. Their Happy  Hour is a nice place to unwind after a long day after work. The menu has a lot to chose   from. The outside seating is a breath of fresh air.

Great chain!!!! I can&#39;t believe I&#39;m giving it 5 stars but it totally deserves it! The wait was insanely long (60-90 mins), but what else would you expect on a holiday weekend Saturday night. We got a great waitress and a bunch of awesome appetizers and great entrees. I got the Mac and cheese burger and it was TO DIE FOR. Please try it - you won&#39;t regret it. Okay, yes you will because you&#39;ll be so full... but don&#39;t think of that! Their cheesecake of course was amazing as well.
Super yummy. Definitely a place to try out. Got the salmon with herb and it was delicious. The atmosphere is really nice. Their free bread is yummy also.

Always love to go to the Cheesecake Factory and this visit for my birthday it was horrible should of went to melting pot but last second I decided to go here as it &#34;was&#34; one of my favorite places. First off took for ever to get our apps when they did arrive the stuffed mushrooms were a joke half of them not stuffed cause they were so tiny waiter said he get a manager.  No manager showed up he said they get another one to us in 7 min well 10 min later no app 12 min our meals arrived.  So i was like well it&#39;s too late for the mushrooms he said he will get them wrapped.  Well then I order blacken shrimp not spicy at all and no flavor they were size of a nickel and my guest order shrimp scampi they were huge and had flavor. This night felt like a disappointment and horrible way to end my birthday.  I was so un happy I just said no to desert here which was a first for me. On top of that they charged me twice for the mushrooms then only took one off I ask for a manger and 13 min later no one arrived I just paid and left.  I should of went to the melting pot for my birthday huge mistake.
Always a pleasure to eat at The Cheesecake Factory, no matter where at. Service and food is always great.

What is it about this place that draws ENORMOUS crowds everywhere?  No matter the location, I&#39;ve never walked into a Cheesecake Factory and been seated without a wait. My recent visit to the one in Cherry Hill was no exception.  Thinking we were &#34;early&#34; for dinner on Saturday evening, we were told to expect a 50 minute wait by a very efficient hostess.  Thankfully it didn&#39;t take quite that long (more like 25 minutes) before we were seated. <br><br>Busy restaurants means tight tables, no matter how big the interior may seem. We were nestled next to two couples on either side, which wasn&#39;t too big a deal, although it&#39;s always awkward to hear every word of other people&#39;s conversation. <br><br>I&#39;m always overwhelmed by the mish-mosh of offerings at CF (which seems to match the decidedly un-themed, lavish decor).  This time, I decided to stick to appetizers, allowing me to try a few different things.  We split the fried mac and cheese balls and the crabby bites, which were both delicious.  I then ordered veggie fries (fried avocado, zucchini, and portobellos), which were unfortunately very disappointing.  I&#39;ve had awesome avocado fries before, but the breading seemed all wrong on these.  Luckily I&#39;d also ordered the pear and blue cheese flatbread, which was excellent - the arugula on top had a lemon-y drizzle that I thoroughly enjoyed. <br><br>Despite being stuffed, we couldn&#39;t leave without cheesecake, so we ordered it to go. I don&#39;t think you can go wrong here, as they&#39;re all delicious, but my Adam&#39;s peanut butter/caramel/brownie concoction was perfect, and actually lasted two days. Perhaps next time I&#39;ll skip the wait and just order cheesecake to go!

I&#39;ve been here a half dozen times and find this to be a decent restaurant. <br><br>They have great ranch dressing, I must say. It has a hint if garlic, yum. Their alcoholic drinks are made well. Their dessert is good, but eight dollars for a small piece if cake is outrageous! Not worth it, when it costs that much to make an entire cake. Their food is hit or miss. My friend got fish tacos once and then shrimp scampi, and didn&#39;t like either. I tasted a friend&#39;s French fries, and they were over salted. That&#39;s annoying coming from fine dining. My sweet corn tamale cakes were too sweet and lacked a good contrast in textures - the cakes should be crisp with a crunchy exterior, but they were super mushy. I&#39;ve found their pasta and salad dishes to be the only consistently yummy dishes. The pumpernickel with oats served right away and warm are a favorite as well. <br><br>They also don&#39;t put the prices on the menu for the alcoholic drinks...not a fan of not knowing what you&#39;re getting for the price.<br><br>If you&#39;re going here, I say stick to the classics. They don&#39;t pull off trendy, unique dishes very well at all. Cocktails tend to be very sweet as well, so watch out if you don&#39;t have a sweet tooth.

The Cheesecake Factory how i love you so, everything about you from the decor to the food makes me wish i could stay here forever. This place is spotless at all times not a spill or a napkin out of place. The bathroom doesn&#39;t smell and its clean. Clearly, people must agree considering the fact that its almost always packed dinner time. which is completely understandable. Some people would walk out and find another place if they said 25-30 minute wait but no one leaves because the food is well worth the wait. <br><br>The menu has food from every continent and every culture. Even the bread and butter is delicious. The food comes out not only smelling good and tasting delicious but looking like a piece of art. The decor alone will make you forget your in a restaurant because you&#39;ll be too busy admiring the architecture and the artwork along the ceiling and the walls.  The waitresses/ waiters manage to always look clean with their white shirts always crisp and never dingy. The silverware isn&#39;t just &#34;clean&#34; it&#39;s shining and the knives are never dull. The bar is fully stocked with a huge flatscreen to compliment it. What&#39;s not to love about The Cheesecake Factory?

Like my cousin Drizzy Drake(not really) says&#34;Why you gotta fight with me at Cheesecake/You know I love to go there,&#34; no fighting but it is always reliable for a great food. To be honest, they under salt everything which i understand is common practice amongst chains(i might have made that up) so i will let it slide and i feel guilty complaining about salt levels on more than one review. Maybe im the problem? lmao anyways food was awesome schmashed it all and murdered the salted caramel cheesecake...easily the best cheesecake in history...ask Junior and Jesus i bet they agree

I&#39;ve been on a Cheesecake Factory kick for the last two weeks and I can&#39;t seem to figure out why. Usually, I find their main dishes to be mediocre, but lately, I&#39;ve craved their appetizers , drinks and cheesecake, so I guess I just answered my own question.<br><br>For two weeks in a row, I have shared an app and a salad with the parties I was with and gotten a slice of cheesecake to-go. I ordered the skinnylicious chopped vegetable salad two weeks in a row, and it doesn&#39;t disappoint.  One week, my group ordered the factory nachos, which I found mediocre, and the other week, the tex mex egg rolls, which were a hit.<br><br>One person ordered the four cheese pasta which was absolutely amazing, and another, the black pepper shrimp, which was okay.<br>Their passion fruit martini  and Asian pear martinis are always a hit, and although they are pricey, they are pretty strong, so it is a good deal.<br><br>As far as cheesecake goes, I have taken a bite of their tiramisu cheesecake (not too great) and their banana cheesecake (delicious) in the past two weeks and have had the red velvet cheesecake (my favorite) in the past.

What happened to this place?!?! I used to love it there. My friend and I went to eat there on 4/25. We were greeted ( or not) by a host I believe. We asked for a table for two. First she said we were standing in the wrong place. She was clearly frustrated. She proceeded to give us a poor attitude. Finally I became irritated and asked if there was an inconvenience? We came in at 9:55pm so I wasn&#39;t sure if they were trying to close. She told me they closed at 11. I told her she seemed unhappy that we asked to sit and she responded by saying she didn&#39;t feel like being there. Wow... that left me speechless.<br>When we sat down to eat, I&#39;ll admit the food was still great. The waitress was nice at first but then became a little snippy when it came to boxing our food. I felt like we weren&#39;t wanted there. I would usually chalk it up to a one time thing but i visited there 3 weeks ago and noticed the customer service was declining then. <br>     Personally, I love a friendly atmosphere. I love to tip. But I couldn&#39;t bring myself to leave more than the average tip (15%) and I rarely ever do that. In the future, I&#39;ll probably love you guys from afar and just buy cheesecake. The people who take the orders for the Cheesecake are at least friendly. Especially this lady who works Tuesday night with short hair.

So... The Cheesecake Factory.... for one, this place has a pretty good size menu with a very extensive list of food varieties and drinks. Oh you can not forget the cheese cake lol. The atmosphere was very nice, and our waitress was very professional. I think I would recommend coming here for lunch versus dinner as this place gets pretty packed in the evening hours. I would definitely recommend at least one visit to this place to scratch it off of the bucketlist!

Yeah it&#39;s a chain, and yeah maybe it takes 4 hours to get a table, but the CSF is top class.  The menu is no lie 40 pages long so you can get a steak or a pizza or a burger or probably something you didnt even know existed.<br><br>The cocktails are great and the cheesecake is awesome, if it wasn&#39;t I think they would have a different name.<br><br>This isn&#39;t actually a factory, keep in mind, and it does have a classy casual atmosphere with some great decor and lighting.
Love coming here for brunch on Sundays! Had Julia as a server the other day and she was wonderful! Keeps the drinks full and makes sure the food comes out quickly.

Place is all hype, mediocre food. They have to much of a menu they need to focus on just a few areas of their menu to make them fantastic. Pricey, loud and we all have been that guy waiting an hour outside for a 3 star overpriced meal. I do really love the patio Seating though and the wait time to eat outside is usually small If there is one at all.

After waiting 2 1/2 hours still didn&#39;t get seated they told us we still have 45 minutes to seat it was to crowded and the staff was very rube including the manager. We was told we have tables assigned to us but the customers didn&#39;t get up yet after being there over 4 hours. You would think after waiting 3 hours and 15 minutes they would be a lil nicer but my family couldn&#39;t wait so we left I would never go here again this location anyway
The food was great<br>We enjoyed the avocado eggroll and the pasta was very good as well<br>The service was ok but the waitress wasn t patient at all

I went out on a date here and was so excited! I&#39;ve been here once before but never realized how LOUD this place was. We were seated immediately, but then it took almost 15 minutes until someone even came up to us to take our drink orders. Our waiter was a young guy, but he was sort of awkward and kinda gave us an &#39;eh&#39; perception. Our apps came out fast, and our second round of drinks did too. I thought to myself, &#34;alright things are looking up.&#34; Well I went to grab my drink and there was a fruit fly in it! I wasn&#39;t grossed out, but taken back a little and just scooped it out with a spoon and proceeded to ask myself &#34;is this gross if I drink this?&#34; I did Anyway. Things were going pretty well until the waiter next to us used my chair to lean his arm against while he was talking to the guests he was serving.... I was so baffled and looked at him and he removed him arm but jeez! That place is close seating as it is and just felt like my space was invaded. The sun was out so they ended up opening the shades, which revealed all of food splatter, hand prints and dust on the benches and tables. Our meal and dessert was great, but the atmosphere was very disappointing. A bunch of the waiters were standing around up front chatting and the tables Surrounding us took forever to be cleared. Very disorganized. The bathrooms were also very messy. I will not be returning here! Pick ups ONLY.

We are not difficult to please, and this is not our first visit to a Cheesecake Factory. In fact, this is my first negative review EVER on Yelp. However, it&#39;s hard to describe how disappointing today&#39;s lunch visit was in this Cherry Hill Location. We were seated quickly, as the restaurant was not too crowded. Our waiter, Eric, was friendly when he took our drink order, and gave us plenty of time to study the menu. I did not realize that was probably because time apparently didn&#39;t matter to him. We made a simple order--Asian lettuce wrap apps, a macaroni and cheese burger (medium well), and a soup and salad. <br><br>Eric left, and two other couples came in and were seated near us. We sat and waited for our appetizer, and time started ticking away. The appetizer took FOREVER to come out, and Eric apologized for the wait. We were fine with that. Then, it came time to wait for the meal. We waited and waited, and watched the other two couples receive their meals. They had burgers and salads too. Their burgers had so much meat that they looked like they did not fit on the bun. Their salads had lots of fresh looking veggies, and their burger came with an abundance of fries on the plate. Eric walked by several times, but never with any food for us. He apologized again for the wait, and left and came back, but still did not have our food. <br><br>We had been in the restaurant an hour at this point. Eric walked by again, and I said, &#34;any luck yet?&#34; He said, &#34;Yes, soon.&#34; I said, &#34;I don&#39;t understand, those two couples came in and ordered long after we did, and are almost through with their food. We only ordered soup and salad and a burger. I don&#39;t understand the delay.&#34; <br><br>Eric left, and the next time we saw him he had our food. I look at my husband&#39;s burger. It was half the size of the bun, and look like it was cooked to the point of being a hockey puck. There were no fries on the plate, and Eric said the fries will be right out. Eric lay down my stupid salad as well, the soup looks fabulous but the salad was nothing but greens tossed in a light dressing. I was surprised that there was not even a cucumber or tomato or a shredded piece of carrot in sight. <br><br>My husband and I just looked at each other stunned, and started eating. He could barely chew his char-burnt burger that was supposed to be medium well. Several minutes later a table runner brought out a small cup of cold french fries.  <br><br>My husband and I were quiet the rest of the meal, and did not see Eric again for a while. No asking how the food was, no offers for refills, nothing. He finally showed up, and spoke just one word, &#34;desserts?&#34; My husband and I responded simultaneously with a somber &#34;no&#34;. Eric quietly gave us our check in and we paid and left. To add insult to injury, The cloth table napkins had shed white lint all over my black sport, my husband&#39;s shirt, and his shorts.

Has a host ever ruined your dinner? Well thus was our experience today: we arrived today (Tuesday) to meet their hosts Robert and a young blonde lady. We were advised that our wait was 45-60 minutes. After waiting 50 minutes we realized there was no one else waiting outside so we walked back in. Upon entering we realized there was no one else waiting, at all. I approached the host and ask about our estimated time of wait and her response was &#34;you were told 60 minutes and it hasnt been 60 minutes&#34;. Her tone was no means friendly or polite. 2 minutes later a new family, a party of 10, just like us walk in and are seated right away. Again, I approach the hostess and ask her why were they seated before us if their table was for the same size party as ours and I have been here 65 minutes now. She says your table is being cleaned now, at this point, my twmper has reached the roof. I polite answer that was not my question so she quickly rushes us to our tanle to avoid the question. As we are being seated we find dirty plates set on the table. We asked to speak to the manager who&#39;s name us Ryan, he was very apologetic for our experience and offered a free appetizer to make us feel better. At rhis point, i am no longer hungry but my family shouldnt have to suffer after waiting such a long time to eat.

went today for lunch. service was horrible and food took forever. was there for about 2 hours and it was not crowded at all. waitress didn&#39;t come by for drink refills. food tasted bland and lettuce was wilted. won&#39;t be back here for a good while.

Middle of the road chain restaurant. The Cherry Hill location is very aesthetically pleasing, and the food is above average. I especially like the white chili chicken and the fennel salad. The menu is ridiculously overwhelming, however. Be prepared to spend some time pouring over the 20+ page menu. Drinks are overpriced and nothing special. Bread basket is good, especially the brown bread. A good option before/after shopping at the CH mall or in the plaza.. if you don&#39;t mind chain restaurants.

Despite our disappointment with the removal of certain items (more on that) the Cheesecake Factory does not disappoint when it comes to consistency or portions.<br><br>We met some friends for brunch on Saturday and were seated right away (we got there when it opened - 11am..ideal) and ordered some drinks.  The cafe mocha, a rich chocolate and coffee blend, is one of my favorite coffee-style drinks.  We were planning to start off with our all-time favorite CF appetizer, the chicken croquettes, but were saddened to learn that they had been removed from the menu.  (deep breath) but we had to move on.  It&#39;s actually a good thing that we didn&#39;t since we filled up on bread and still couldn&#39;t finish our entrees.<br><br>I ordered the breakfast fiesta burrito; loaded with cheese, potatoes, scrambled eggs, chorizo sausage, peppers and onions, stuffed inside a giant tortilla shell and served on top of a very spicy and delicious tomatillo sauce.  They also present it with a side dish of black beans, but I barely touched the mundane additives; I&#39;d ask for the burrito without them next time.. or substitute some fruit.  Either way, the burrito was amazing and I almost finished it, but remembed to save room for dessert.<br><br>My wife was feeling more lunch&#39;ish and went with the chicken littles (an oxymoron if I&#39;ve ever seen one).  Her plate came loaded with fresh (easy to tell it&#39;s not factory compressed) chicken tenders, mashed potatoes and a corn/zucchini succotash.  The chicken was delicious, especially with the bbq sauce.<br><br>Our companions chose the same style of entress, one got a hamburger and the other a breakfast sandwich.  Both reported them as tasty.<br><br>Dessert brought the next round of disappointment.  Maybe they moved it, but they used to have an awesome chocolate cake, layered with chocolate and coconut.  By far, one fo the best non-cheesecake desserts in their repertoire.  It, along with the chicken croquettes, will always be remembered.<br><br>Nonetheless, we&#39;ll definitely be back!

Love it here! Haven&#39;t had a bad experience yet and hopefully it stays that way.<br><br>You can&#39;t go wrong ordering the Louisiana Chicken or Spicy Chipotle Chicken Pasta. Super tasty!<br><br>The days that I want to eat light, I&#39;d order the BBQ Ranch Chicken Salad with the dressing on the side. Portions are always huge and delish!<br><br>For cheesecake, I&#39;ve only tried the Red Velvet and Oreo. Both arw superb!<br><br>Service is always very good and friendly as well.

Went on Good Friday to celebrate my daughter&#39;s and cousin&#39;s birthdays.  Service was good, drinks (both alcohol and non) were tasty.  Food was good except my cousin&#39;s pasta, which was very dried out.  I encouraged her to send it back, but she was starving and did not want to wait for a new plate to arrive.  The rest of the meal was good and our waitress was very attentive.

Ugh hate to leave another review but service has gone down. Went to eat and didn&#39;t sit at the bar this time. Say a high top . Waitress didn&#39;t come over for over 15 minutes to take our drink order. Food took over 35 minutes and all we ordered was an app and a sandwich! Took even longer to drop the check and scan it, and was just generally only there when we didn&#39;t need her, not there when we needed her. Also, I stood at the host stand for ten minutes before someone acknowledged me and finally just sat myself at a high top. Maybe only takeout from this location for now on.

Brought my boyfriend here for this birthday, tagging along my friend and her boyfriend. The 1st time I was here, there was a very cute server, and he was our server. (I was still single then, so it&#39;s okay) I didn&#39;t know if I was drooling over the food or over his cuteness

Went for my daughters 18th Birthday dinner, appetizers were great, recommend the fried chicken sliders. Dinner portions were large, and the menu ranged from Italian to Mexican a little something from whatever you would be in the mood for. As expected the cheesecake selection was plentiful, our family ordered four separate types, celebration was our favorite. Waitress was young and a little distracted by friends of hers at another table that is only negative and that wasn&#39;t too bad, would definite go back again

So tonight my son and I went out for a late dinner (he got off work at The Cherry Hill Mall at 10pm). We got in the restaurant about 10:10, we were seated immediately. Our server greeted us, seemed very friendly at first. We asked for waters with lemon and for bread, we got water no lemon, no bread... I flagged him down for lemon. No problem, he got it for me. Let&#39;s say it&#39;s approximately 10:20. He never returned to our table until 10:53. We asked for bread again... I told my son,&#34; if my food is not on this table by 11:00 I&#39;m leaving&#34;. The food arrived at 10:56 for my son, mine came at 10:57. He was moving in a way that we could barely ask him for anything. He was more attentive to a couple 2 tables away. I just want to say, I tip over 20% when I&#39;m out. I keep extra cash to make sure I can be generous. Needless to say the $20 I had on me to go towards his tip, I used for the food (14.95). Our total was 27.14 (my son got an appetizer). The highest tip was $5 and some change. I planned for $10 no matter what. He got me a container for my leftovers and went to get me a bag... He never came back... I was gonna leave $5 but not returning with the bag cost him another $3 my son left $2. I used cash so he wouldn&#39;t have my card info... If this is the job you chose, do it! I love being a Blessing to someone, but not when I&#39;m ignored. If you can&#39;t show interest in your customers don&#39;t expect interest in my wallet... Good Night...

Best cheesecakes ever! I have not dined at this restaurant, I have only gone in to order cheesecakes several times for birthdays or other occasions. Great selection, very creamy and soft texture and a lot of different flavors to choose from. Yes, average price of $8 or $9 for a little slice of cheesecake is expensive, (or $50+ for a whole) but it is not easy to find a comparable product elsewhere, even though The Cheesecake Factory cheesecakes are not freshly made; they just come frozen from their factory on the West Coast. They are still delicious!<br>The service is ok, depending on how crowded the place is. Sometimes it takes a little while to get your order ready to go. The only thing I hate about the experience is the parking lot! The parking lot is almost always full, and it is very hard to find a spot closer to the restaurant. However, they do have a couple of to-go parking spaces, if you order online and enter the make and model of your car, they will bring it out to you, for a tip. Wish they just had a cheesecake shop without the restaurant, maybe in a less busy shopping strip.<br>Oh, and this is funny but the doors to enter the restaurant are so big and heavy, you need some real muscle strength, which I completely lack. I always end up needing help from someone to pull open the door to enter.

Absolutely terrible service again, however this time we were never sat. Came in large party had called about a wait earlier and was told by a manager seating would be possible by 5:30. Arrived there and was told a hr wait which was fine however the manager had a nasty I don&#39;t care attitude towards us so we left and went to brio, better service there anyway. Needless to say I will never step foot in that store again. Didn&#39;t catch the managers name but a very nasty individual.

Note that if you&#39;re going here for CHEESECAKE, it gets 12 stars. The Red Velvet Cheesecake should be illegal its so good. With that said, the 3 stars is for overall.<br><br>First things first; I have never been here and NOT had to wait a ridiculous amount of time to get a table. It is CONSTANTLY packed. When you finally do get a table, settle in, because the menu is TWELVE PAGES LONG. Yes. The food menu....for a restaurant....is 12 pages long. Its like a phone book of food choices. It is an obnoxious amount of choices. <br><br>When you make it past your 2 billion choices and settle on something, I hope youre hungry. My little brother got a starter salad, AND GOT THE HALF PORTION, and I think they brought it in a wheelbarrow. Do people seriously eat this much?! (although by looking at the usual bloated, obese Cheesecake Factory clientele, it would appear so.)  As for myself, I ordered the americana burger, medium, which came overcooked, yet still juicy. <br><br>The food is good and the dessert is transcendent. The decor is nice, but spacing between tables is kinda tight. Prices are pretty standard for going out to eat; $10-12 for a burger, and $9-12 for mixed drinks. (Full bar is a plus.)<br><br>Overall, Cheesecake Factory is a very safe bet. You&#39;re almost guaranteed to find SOMETHING on their War and Peace sized menu to enjoy, and it will most likely be tasty at worst. If you can SOMEHOW save room for dessert, you will end your meal on a high note.

My friend and I stopped by here to grab a bite before the pre-screening for Snow White and the Huntsman at AMC Lowes nearby. We did not have to wait for a table/booth, and he had already been seated and served bread by the time I arrived.<br><br>Within moments of my arrival, we were informed that the original server was finished her shift and another waitress was taking over. No problems there. Plus our order was taken in a timely manner (a cobb salad and a side salad). My cobb salad was amazing, from presentation to taste, and was like literally the best salad I&#39;ve ever had (even though I ordered it without the avacado and tomato. The only thing I&#39;d say is they never give you enough salad dressing (I ordered some mixed in as well as 2 on the side) Our server was really on point with refills and dressing/bread refills though.<br><br>Definitely worth stopping if you&#39;re nearby!

Don&#39;t ask me how, don&#39;t ask me why, but when hitting The Cake it&#39;s essential to get Mexican food, believe me. Hopefully they don&#39;t have to do an overhaul of the kitchen staff this upcoming year. Good service is a hit or miss, server forgot our guac and chips last meal. Sad.
Great restaurant w extensive menu, friendly service, beautiful decor, and priced well for generous portions.

I love this place! We went on a afternoon and our server Frankie was awesome! It was a real great experience except for half way true there was a couple coming in sitting down next to us who seemed to be working there cuz a lot of servers stopped by to chat and it&#39;s fine, I know this happens but it became annoying after a while cuz they where kind of loud and it became busy around that table!

Freddie was hands down the BEST server I&#39;ve had this year. Customer service overall is in the toliet, but I actually had to give Freddies&#39; manager an earful of positive praise! Fantastic service, Freddie, you made me day.
The mac and cheese bites are amazing. Love their burgers. Cookie dough cheesecake is great!

We ordered two pasta dishes tonight. Garlic Noodles &amp; Evelyns Pasta<br>LONG SILIVER HAIR  in Garlic Noodles and Evelyns pasta tasted burnt.<br>Manager came over and couldn&#39;t make eye contact with us, sounded like a drunk!<br>Our waiter was on point, he could give the manager a few tips!<br>How disappointing, better to go somewhere else, this place is going down hill fast!

I was so surprised my friend and I had to wait 20 minutes for a seat on a Thursday night! You can definitely tell this is a hot spot for people in the area. I wouldn&#39;t call this fine dining by any means but the environment for this chain is quite nice with their high ceilings and dim lighting.<br><br>I ordered some salad while my friend ordered the chicken madeira. I haven&#39;t visited a Cheesecake Factory since freshman year of college but the portion sizes are big just like I remembered. The salad&#39;s ingredients weren&#39;t particularly fresh but I guess I didn&#39;t expect much coming here.<br><br>My main beef with this place is that my phone was dying and I asked the hostess in the front if I could charge my phone up there. &#34;Sorry, we don&#39;t have outlets for the public&#34;. Ummmm....excuse me??????? I&#39;ve never been turned down like this at any restaurant. Either way, I&#39;d probably come back since, like McDonald&#39;s, since the price is fair for the food quality, which is predictable. But I&#39;ll just need to remember my portable battery next time.
Terrible for brunch... Uncooked pancakes and French toast. The cook can&#39;t make a proper omelet. Extremely disappointed!!!

I love cheesecake factory, but today is my anniversary and I could not go out to a restaurant because my daughter is very ill. We decided to order cheesecake factory when i called I was on hold forever and then the person specifically asked if I wanted bread and butter I told her yes. We got our food and mine looked like food slopped together no presentation and I am assuming the sauces just mixed together looked like soup and my mashed potatoes were not mashed but potato chunks and my steak was so done I could hardly get my knife threw. I guess to get good food you have to eat in the restaurant! Don&#39;t order take out they don&#39;t take pride in what they put in container. I got the combination dinner chicken meridea and steak Diane, 21$$ meal and it was ice cold...

My girlfriend and I walked in. Their were a lot of people waiting to be seated, but for a Saturday evening I can understand. We walked up to the hostess and she told us about a 40 minute wait.  I was surprised but about 40 minutes later we were seated and during our wait we were smart and looked at the menu and already knew what we wanted. Our waiter Jason was very nice and knowledgeable with the menu. We both ordered burgers and I ordered a drink, we shared a Caesar salad and it was very good. Before we left we bought a slice of cheesecake to go, overall good experience here just wish the prices were a bit lower.  The menu has a lot of items on it so if you have time look through it prior to being seated.

I have eaten here a number of times for dinner or lunch. This review however is not about the dinner items. On this trip two weeks ago, I was here to sample the breakfast brunch for the first time. My wife ordered her usual breakfast favorite, bagel &amp; lox platter. Besides the fact the bagel came nearly five minutes after her platter arrived, she enjoyed her breakfast. I ordered the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes. Now I love my pancakes cooked a little extra but these pancakes were just a little too overcooked. They were edible; but burned.  <br><br>Service was decent, just felt like it was early and everyone wasn&#39;t quite awake yet. Never got a second cup of coffee.

5 star Megan... she came to save the day... our family sat for nearly 20 mins waiting for a server to wait on us, nothing. Finally we flagged Megan down and she sincerely apologized for our wait and explained to us that this was not her area of dining but was more than glad to take our order. She is very attentive and sweet... I had read other reviews and was quite unsure how this experience would turn out from our usual CS Factory near our home. Kudos to the management for hiring such a wonderful young woman.. Megan really takes pride in her work! And as I stated before she truly saved the day!! Btw Dinner was DELICIOUS!! Megan recommended a tasty delicious meal for our daughter whom is quite the picky eater...

My fiancé and I ate at cheesecake for lunch today after shopping at the mall. I ordered Renee&#39;s special (chicken salad sandwich and chicken tortilla soup...and a side salad). I almost always order this because it&#39;s 1.delicious 2.a lot of good 2. Great price. I usually get the sour dough bread instead of the bread the chicken salad comes on.  I ended up taking half of it home and I&#39;m sure it will taste just as good tomorrow. Victoria was our waitress at the high top by the bar. She was very friendly and great waitress.

I pretty much always like my visit to cheesecake.  If it weren&#39;t for the long wait, I would prob like to go more often. <br><br>Fortunately, when we went on a Thursday night at 6:30pm at this location, we were able to get seated right away.  Definitely a plus. <br><br>I ordered the Grilled Chicken and Avocado Sandwich.  Good as usual.  The chicken may have been a little bit on the dry side but I enjoyed it anyway.

I&#39;ve been here 2 times now and I&#39;m not entirely impressed. The food is average but the cost is unreasonably high. The service is poor and you are left waiting a while for anything you ask for. The place itself is kept well and presentable. I could see going here every once in a blue moon but it&#39;s not really a place to go all of the time. The menu is a book with many options so it&#39;s a good group eating type of place.

Pretty sure they gave me an uncooked veggie burger last night, or it was just flat it disgusting. Avocado egg rolls had brown avocados in them. And I stood out the counter for pick up and the girl took a few people before me although I was there first. Completely disappointed.
Anybody has stomach problem after Friday 01/06/17. The whole family was sick over weekend. The service is good. The food is so so.

Great food. A lot to choose from a large menu. We made it a regular place to eat on Sunday morning brunch after church. It&#39;s slower and you don&#39;t have to wait in their long lines. Highly recommend!!!!!

I just got home from a big family brunch at the Cheesecake Factory. It was probably my last visit. There was a ridiculously long wait for the food. I did enjoy my pancakes, which were served with only a tiny cup of syrup. My tomato juice was sour. Others needed more coffee, and were complaining about not having enough syrup. There was a long wait for the server to come back, then another long wait for coffee, syrup, and to have my sour tomato juice replaced with supposedly fresh squeezed orange juice. I stopped eating for quite some time, because I had nothing to wash down dry pancakes. The orange juice at least wasn&#39;t spoiled, but I have a hard time believing it&#39;s fresh squeezed, when my supermarket brand orange juice that comes in half gallon cartons tastes much better. I understand that people are busy, but the service was so horrible that meal should have been comped. No one even apologized for the endless waits for anything, or offered any reasons.<br><br>2-18-18<br>I&#39;m updating my review after having breakfast with my family at the Cheesecake Factory. I didn&#39;t pick the place! There was a long wait to be seated. Once again, the service was horrible. The meals were not all served at once, or even close to all at once. One meal was sent back. There was a long wait for it to be corrected. One was wrong but eaten anyway. There is too long of a wait for ANYTHING. My French toast was served without syrup. Supposedly, the syrup had to be heated. Couldn&#39;t that be done while the meal was cooking? The food was only lukewarm when I finally got room temperature syrup. I didn&#39;t send it back, because I didn&#39;t want to wait all day for a replacement. I didn&#39;t take home any leftovers because I didn&#39;t want to wait all day for a box. It was bad enough that we finally left 2 1/2 hours after being seated.

I come from a restaurant background and am not usually a complainer unless I feel necessary. We decided to go to The Cheesecake Factory because it was conveniently in the shopping center we were in, but I can guarantee you I will not be back. We ordered a burger, a Salad, Red wine and sangria. I stared at our drinks sitting up at the bar for at least 10 minutes already made before they were brought to the table. 40 minutes into our wait for our food someone came to us stating the chicken from the salad fell on the floor and they are currently remaking it.  It came about 5 minutes after that and the fries with the burger were ice cold. I told the waitress and she quickly came back with more fries and they were the exact same temperature.  Frustrated and annoyed, we simply said forget it. We got our full priced check, paid, and still left a non-deserving 20% tip. Thanks for nothin&#39; and see ya never.

I&#39;ve eaten here a number of times and have been satisfied with each visit. For starters the Buffalo Blasts are really good. Really thin and crunchy fried chicken bites that come with dipping sauces. Really good If your into your wings. Chicken Romano was my last entree and was on the heavier side but was really good. The Oreo cheesecake was a chocolate lovers dream. And the cocktails at this place are exceptional as well. It can be a little pricey but I think that you can work around the pricing by learning the menu. Like to think this is one of the better chains around. So for a chain it&#39;s a 4. Reason being even with it being really good I&#39;ve never caught myself urging to come back and I wouldn&#39;t plan my day around going. So it&#39;s a 4.

Unbelievably crowded. $7 beer on tap, $10 suavigion blanc. Mediocre food at best. Stay away from this over priced and awful chain restaurant. Baked potatoes soup was like paste. Hibachi steak was swimming in teriyaki making it inedible. Burgers were just OK. Kids liked the cheesecake. Bad, bad,bad. Go visit something owned by a hard working chef.

Absolutely horrific customer service and I&#39;ll start from the beginning. I called 2 weeks prior stating my son requested to dine there for his birthday with his family, a party of 15. I was told that they do not take reservations but reccomend coming around 3pm, between lunch and dinner, and they should be able to accommodate us within 30 minutes. In my opinion, if you don&#39;t take reservations for at least large parties you are setting yourself up for failure and fail they did. We arrive and are given a 60 to 90 minute wait time. That was hard to swallow but, that my friends was only the beginning. We were finally given our tables, yes 2 different tables, after 90 patient minutes they couldn&#39;t figure out how to sit us all together. So my husband and I kindly got to wave occasionally to my son and part of the family throughout the meal. When we asked why we were separated they had the audacity to blame it on me for walking away to speak with the family for 1 minute and then returning to put my name in. You had 90 minutes to make it right after I told them the poor information I was given on the phone. We made it very clear we were all together but, one table was provided much faster service, luckily it was my son&#39;s. My table however,  took 30 minutes for drinks and both my husband and I were forgotten. My son&#39;s table was finishing appetizers by the time we had a beverage. We ordered, waiters switching shifts, timing was off at every step, the food comes out eventually and again my husband has no meal. We were told there was a mix up and it would be out in 5 minutes. My husband was so disgusted he couldn&#39;t even eat anything. I asked to speak to a manager and instead of owning what a terrible job they&#39;ve done his response is we really don&#39;t handle large parties well. If you know your deficiency then why aren&#39;t you improving something? The hostesses did nothing but, act annoyed and bothered by everything. The manager had zero remorse and took my husband&#39;s meal off the bill because I asked him to.  The food was subpar at best and one star is a gift. I have never felt more uncomfortable at a restaurant in my life and you should be ashamed of the rude and disorganized mess you are running.  Side note, you also should stop putting chairs on the end of booths, its an ADA violation I&#39;ll be reporting.

The menu is huge, with a lot of fusion between cuisines.  Its good to have a lot of choices, but it also means that there isn&#39;t really anything that they do particularly well.  I have gotten the black pepper shrimp, which is spicy enough.  The Vietnamese spring rolls are pretty good, but over priced.  The Cheesecake Factory definitely has better food than Friday&#39;s, Applebees, Chili&#39;s and the like.  <br><br>Everyone always talks about the potion size at the cheesecake factory, and they are huge.  I&#39;d recommend taking half of your food home for the next meal.  <br><br>The service at the cheesecake factory can be pretty slow, it seems common for appetizers to arrive a minute before entrees, and even drinks tend to take a while. <br><br>This cheesecake factory is always busy, and you&#39;ll likely have to wait for a table.<br><br>Very loud when dining.

Don&#39;t live too close so only go out here on a Sunday when I am going to food shop at wegmans. This place is always a mad house and always packed! We wanted to sit outside so the guy said he could seat us right away , while stepping to the side of the counter the hostess was so confused he walked outside twice until 10mins later finally seating us. Was a nice day so didn&#39;t mind sitting in the sun, but the table was black and hott couldn&#39;t even put our hands on it so I decided to move it sideways out the sun myself. I ended up gettin a pizza n salad n my boyfriend got a turkey club and salad. Normally your salad would come out first , but here it came out with our meals and I wasn&#39;t too happy about that. The Caesar salad was so good. The pizza not so much it was fought and flimsy and I complained and the waiter just shoved my pizza back in the oven, like u couldn&#39;t offer to make a new one ? Very weird. We didn&#39;t know it was Cheesecake day so Cheesecake was half off so we ordered the birthday celebration and it was amazing and I&#39;m not a Cheesecake fan. This review is based on their pizza and service because services took forever. I would go back for another salad that&#39;s about all !
First, the wait is too long. The service wasn&#39;t great. Food wasn&#39;t all that. Tried it once never returning.

The service was great &amp; our food was amazing ! My only disappointment was the &#34;freshly baked bread&#34; which was kind of hard and definitely didn&#39;t taste fresh. Other than that, everything was great. I&#39;d definitely go again!

Menu is very expansive, which is good &amp; bad. Lots of choices, but also a lot to navigate. The wait can be long on top of parking being difficult, but I don&#39;t mind parking far anyways. Service was decent and food was very fresh. Although it feels rushed towards the end of their visit, the whole part of dining is the cheesecake selection. I don&#39;t eat cheesecake very often, but they set the standard for the stuff!

This is the WORST cheesecake factory ive been to. The wait was horrible and the food was not cooked all the way and un-seasoned. They did not seem to care about customer service at all worst experience Ive ever had!!
You can never go wrong here. Have been so many times and always leave happy! The banana cream cheesecake is to die for! I cannot leave this place without getting a slice.

Had dinner on a Saturday night.  The wait for the table was endless. Don&#39;t understand the appeal.  Finally sat at tiny table for 2.  The noise level was unreal.  Had to practically shout at the waiter to be heard.  Forget trying to converse with my date.  Then they lowered the lights. I could barely see what I was eating.  The food was actually good but no plans to go back there.

I want to start with the wait. I came here with Jesus Christ and he is no longer with me. I&#39;ve changed my clothes easily over a million times. I&#39;ve seen the menu change from berries and leaves to decadent cheesecakes, not that I would know how those taste..

We came here at my foreign guests&#39; request, and it was a great reminder of why I hate Cheesecake Factory. It&#39;s all hype and the products are never very good. Case in point- our drinks were entirely flawed and the waitress didn&#39;t even apologize (the tea was missing the teabag... By the time they brought it the water had gotten cold. The cream had started to turn, and sodas were flat. Total fail). In general, it annoys me that they don&#39;t respond to customer requests-- CF policy prevents customizing orders, and if you ask for a meat salad without the meat you still have to pay the full price, despite the fact that they offer few vegetarian salads. Coming here makes me hate consumerism and the American market system. Ugh.

This place never disappoints. If you have never been here it&#39;s a must. The only thing that is a bit of a hassle is the wait time. They only take reservations during the weekdays, weekend is first come first serve and that means anywhere from 45-hour and a half wait. We waited hour and a half. Their menu is the size of a library book they offer probably a good 200 items I have been here a handful of times and still always get the same appetizer user after trying a few. Thai lettuce wraps. Huge portion deliscious always. This time I got a bacon date pizza and my wife got the pasta carbonara. I would call this place more of a gourmet diner. Kids are still present its super loud the menu is extensive they offer brunch on the weekends but the food quality does not lack at all. I give four stars bc of the wait times, not food quality although this time I went I did have to send an appetizer back because it had a hair on it but honestly let&#39;s face it that happens everywhere. We all have hair and can&#39;t cover it up 100% of the time so I don&#39;t get mad about it. Just sent back and server was great about the whole thing. Service is always top notch here even though their extremely busy.

Went with A chargrilled coulette steak they were offering for a decent rate. It was better than any filet mignon I ever had. Ate every last bite. Good service. Nice atmosphere. Will cost you aorund a hundred bucks for a family of 4 if you include price of drinks. They do NOT have a kids menu. We ordered a plate and had them split it for our kids since the portions are too big for each of our kids.

Came here on a weekend and was shocked on how fast we were sat. Normally, I&#39;d be waiting at least half hour to over an hour, so definitely A+ to that. I had my baby with me so they were also very kind enough to give us a nice size booth so the car seat would fit in with us. Service was excellent! Everything we ordered came out at a decent time.<br><br>For apps, we ordered mini crab bites and these chicken wonton things. Skip the crab bites if u plan on getting them! Extremely overpriced and they were so tiny. The chicken wonton things (forgot the names) was delicious though. It had a somewhat curry taste to it. For main meals, I ordered fish tacos and my husband ordered this spicy pasta with shrimp. They both weren&#39;t that great. I ordered my fish tacos tempura style, but when it came out, it was this heavy fried dough. Tempura is supposed to be light. They should not ask if I want it tempura or grilled. It should be wiuld u like it fried or grilled. If I knew it wasn&#39;t tempura battered, I would have gone for grilled. The tacos weren&#39;t horrible but could have been better if I actually got what I wanted. My husband&#39;s pasta was good, but he didn&#39;t like it much. He didn&#39;t think it had enough spice to it. He said he remembered it differentially.<br><br>Upon leaving, we decided to order a whole cheesecake. They didn&#39;t have it ready and was completely frozen. I was a bit upset bc I couldn&#39;t eat it right when I got home, but once defrosted, it was quite delicious!! Go for the banana cream. Mmmmmm

I took my wife here for her birthday. It was 8PM on a Friday, I did expect it to be a little busy. I tried making reservations the day before but they don&#39;t take reservations. We ended up waiting 45 minutes for a table. It took the waitress a while to get our drink order. When she came back with our drinks she took our appetizer order and asked for our dinner order. It then took an eternity to get our appetizers. We had the appetizers and the dinner came immediately before we finished. I was aggrevated at this point but to be fair the food was very good. I had the chicken Marsala and my wife had the chicken colleto (a lemon sauce) which she enjoyed very much. We both had cheesecake for dessert. I had the chocolate chip cookie dough and my wife had the Oreo. They were both excellent. The atmosphere was very nice and we enjoyed the surroundings. The waitress was friendly but either over worked or unorganized. My biggest complaints were the lack of reservations, the wait for our drinks and appetizers and the fact that dinner was brought too soon after the appetizers.<br>I do recommend this place but would avoid Friday nights.

We just moved to Cherry Hill and were asking around for a good place to get dinner one night and someone suggested we check out the cheesecake factory. Being from New York we are very familiar with the cheesecake factory as a Times Square establishment and were kind of surprised to find that it is the literal local gathering place for all people all of ages combined in our neighborhood. I personally just don&#39;t get it. It&#39;s a it&#39;s a chain restaurant and feels very dime a dozeny inside. People actually dress up to go here, which confuses me as it would be like dressing up to go to a TGI Fridays. The food wasn&#39;t bad but it wasn&#39;t great. The cocktails were weak. The service was decent (our waitress was wearing at least 23 pieces of visible flare lol for the office space fans out there!) If you want to eat mediocre chain food head on over to the Cheesecake Factory, or Fridays, or Outback...is there really a difference? Okay, outback has the blooming onion which is bangin.

I would say as a first timer here it was very good. I was only a little confused as to the theme of this place because I was able to get everything from Vietnamese shrimp summer rolls to hot white chicken chili, and I mean hot. Though aside from that I can see why there is a line out the door because this place is very good and their cheesecake is as well. I recommend coming here for a nice family outing.

Always a good option when dining with multiple people who have different tastes! Over 100 menu options that are extremely varied, and I mean, who can pass up a cheesecake. The drinks aren&#39;t all that strong, but they are yummy. Probably wouldn&#39;t come here for the bar scene, but definitely would suggest for apps and dinner!

Good food with nice huge portions.  I think they have a little something for everyone on their menu. It&#39;s a large variety. Service is usually good too!  My only complaint would be the last time I visited, I froze.   I ordered Steak Diane  and Shrimp scampi combo. The steak and gravy was perfect, my shrimp were over cooked and mushy. Also had the crab dip appetizer. It was tasty but spicy. I for one can not do spicy food. They should note it on the menu or have the server explain it. I saw no clues in the ingredients. I&#39;d visit again still.

I&#39;m tempted to give four stars, because I&#39;ve never had a bad experience (besides the standard wait time for a table, of course), but something is holding me back... most likely, the extra weight I put on after my meal on Saturday evening.<br><br>Picture this: three relatively health-conscious girls out to dinner.  Nobody was trying to get all South Beach or anything, but it was clear that we wanted healthy meals so we could splurge a little on dessert.  Two orders of wasabi tuna and an order of miso salmon seemed like a safe enough bet.<br><br>Not so much.  My friends&#39; wasabi tuna entrees were really delish, but the wasabi crust had a fried consistency to it-- good for sure, but totally not necessary.  My salmon dish had an absolute river of thick creamy sauce going around the plate.  Luckily, the salmon itself was on dry land, located on top of an island of rice.  <br><br>I just don&#39;t understand why the people behind the menu at Cheesecake Factory think that healthy food has to be bombarded with fat before people will order it.  The salmon was fantastic with just the miso glaze-- and the tuna didn&#39;t need such a thick, greasy crust.    <br><br>Oh, the CF does have healthier selections on the menu.  You&#39;ll know what they are because they are listed with the words &#34;Weight Management&#34; before each item.  What genius came up with this idea?!  Can I take his or her place on the marketing team when he or she gets fired?

If you want to see a wide range of inspect species, come here. Flies everywhere, gnats over your bread, smashed relatives of both underneath your table. Gross.<br><br>Our table was wet when we were seated and the utensils that we were to eat off were laying right on it. Appetizing!<br><br>While I love the food at Cheesecake, you&#39;re better off ordering take out and eating on your dashboard in the car.<br><br>Bugs are a no no, especially if I&#39;m dining in. Try placing your silverware in the folded napkins versus the nasty tables wiped by dirty ass rags. Kitchen 101, surfaces carry the most germs!<br><br>Never felt this dirty leaving a CF.  Super disappointed. Guess I&#39;ll have to wait for the ones out of state.
